They included a big free breakfast in the morning, free movie rentals to take to my room in the evening, beach equipment to take to the beach the next day, and lots of fresh fruit in my room. The room was clean and cozy and the mattress felt like mine at home. Every time I came down from my room I was greeted and treated like family. Love Bay Shores!
Manager Response: Victoria,   Thanks for the great review! It sounds like you had a wonderful time in Newport Beach. We hope you'll come back in the summer to enjoy our beautiful beaches and beach equipment!

Summary Heading: Would definitely stay here again!  A+ all the way!
Summary: The Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel far exceeded my expectations.  In a time of big chain hotels that all look the same and you are just one of hundreds of guests, this small hotel really makes the effort to connect with its guests.  So, first and foremost, the customer service is excellent!  We mostly dealt with Jenny, who was very helpful and friendly.  She even sent us a postcard thanking us for our stay!  Now for the pros and cons of the hotel itself: The Pros:  The room was clean.  Towels were in good condition and bed was comfortable with ample covers and pillows.  There is good lighting in the bathroom, even a light over the tub/shower which is rare.  The bathroom had plenty of counter space as well.  There is a pretty nice sized closet with a mini-fridge and safe.  There is a
Manager Response: Sandyinlv,   Thank you for the stellar review. We appreciate your feedback about our breakfast, and with respect to parking, if you ever need to park on the street we will provide you with a parking pass (we cover all the parking fees for you up front).  The elevator works well, and is a very fun way to get up to that beautiful sundeck you mentioned. We love the vintage vibes at Bay Shores! There are great sunset views to enjoy and you were right about the bottle of wine. It's a great way to unwind and relax.   We hope you'll stay with us again soon.

Summary: Excellent location with very short walk to the bay, beach, or restaurants.  The staff is very attentive and caring.  You can barrow DVDs or beach equipment like umbrellas, chairs, towels, and boogie boards.  Parking is also convenient.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Zach. All that beach equipment does come in handy with the beach so close by, doesn't it? In the summer time it's a great way to spend a warm day in the California sunshine. We hope you enjoyed the rest of your time in Newport Beach and that you'll stay with us again!

Summary: Fantastic hotel. Super nice staff!  They even have warm cookies in the afternoon. And popcorn and movies for guests to check out.  The front desk staff really know the town and good ideas for food.  Great location. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Mary K,   I'm so glad you hear you were able to take advantage of the movies and popcorn. If you snag a couple cookies and head up to your room it's like a mini movie theater in your room! Thank you for the wonderful review. I'm so glad my staff was helpful and eager to make some good recommendations. I hope you'll come back and stay with us again.

Summary: What an amazing experience and hotel. I am not going to lie, I was a tad bit hesitant to reserve a room here, but after the reviews I just went with it. I am use to concierge club level type rooms and service and this hotel didn't disappoint me or my daughter. We had the most wonderful time. The moment we stepped foot onto the property Warren made us feel right at home. My daughter (8) quickly warmed up to him and we followed him on a tour of the hotel. All the amenities you receive are top notch and everything is so quaint. Once we got to our room using the old school elevator (another thing my daughter loved) we immediately feel in love with the cozy, cute and beach cottage like decor. The view was amazing, the bed was comfortable and clean and the bathroom had the little
Manager Response: Yari2566,   Thank you so much for such a great review! It sounds like you got the experience that we've become quite well known for. We love to welcome you and treat you like family and it sounds like Warren was able to get you and your daughter all settled in and comfortable.    I'm glad you got the chance to take out the beach equipment to enjoy the California sunshine. Our location does make it easy to get out to the park with the kiddos, head to the harbor, or walk to the beach.   We are so happy to hear you will be back next year! What a fun thing to already have on the calendar to look forward to.

Summary Heading: What a gem of a hotel!
Summary: Please, please, please don't do what we did and judge a book by its cover! When first pulling in to the car park our thoughts turned to "what have we done" but all was to change upon entering the foyer. A classic reception manned by Jenny was the start of a wonderful stay at this hotel. It's all about the little things, like fish fruit in your room and in the well stocked breakfast (but available all day) kitchen area. coffee, tea, fresh cookies baked on site, pineapple water, croissant and cereals. Take a walk up onto the roof deck and see amazing views of the marina to one side and the beach/coastline to the other! Positioned within a 2 minute walk of the pier and restaurants and bars, location is excellent. Beach chairs, surf boards, umbrellas and beach towels are available,
Manager Response: Chris,   I apologize for the late response, but I just had to say thank you for staying with us and leaving us such a wonderful review! We're happy to hear you had such a great stay at Bay Shores. We really do try to go the extra mile with the "little things" so you feel welcome and comfortable.   We hope you'll stay with us again in the future. If you ever want to book another stay, just call our front desk directly and they'll take care of the rest!

Summary Heading: your property is a little  diamond in the rough
Summary: we where very impressed in the way you received  us,.we felt like celebrities Jenny the receptionist showed us all the services included in your hotel.The brief note in our room was very thoutghful.the housekeeping  was exceptional in every aspect,we asked extra towels we got them.the chocalates was appreciated also.The hotel is well located,in a secure area,close to the beach and the marina. The hotel is not a high end but it is affordable and very clean. PS .for people who want to stay longer ,there is two things that are missing  in the room and that is a microwave  and a fridge.Thank you for a beatiful experience at your hotel.
Manager Response: Pierrerathier,   Thank you for leaving us such a detailed review. We're so glad to hear you were treated like celebrities when you checked in. Jenny is wonderful, and I'm happy to hear you were made to feel so special and comfortable.   We always welcome feedback about our rooms and I appreciate the great suggestion about the microwave/fridge for guests wanting a longer stay.   We hope you'll come back and stay with us again soon and let us turn that 4 stars into 5!

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet, easy walk to the beach
Summary: We arrived in early December for a four night stay. The staff goes out of their way to make sure that your stay is successful. The location is an easy one block walk to the beach. They have all the beach equipment that one might need; we used the beach chairs and were very happy. The room was clean and there is an elevator. Sometimes their parking lot was full, but on the street parking (side street) was easy to find and easy to access. The back of the hotel is 1/2 block from the harbor and is an easy walk to the Lighthouse restaurant that had good food for breakfast. They also serve a free and good breakfast at the hotel which we used several days. At night, we would walk to the beach walkway for a half mile walk to restaurants to the north of the hotel. Yes, I will be coming
Manager Response: Hkcpa,   What a great review! It sounds like you had a great stay in Newport Beach, and I'm so happy to hear you felt comfortable during your stay with us at Bay Shores. You'll have to forgive my late response- I just wanted to let you know that I appreciate your kind words and 5 star review.   I'm glad my staff went out of their way to make you feel at home. It's what we're famous for, and I'm glad you had a wonderful experience. We hope you'll choose to stay with us again next time you come to Newport Beach. Next time you want to book a room, just give our front desk a call directly and we'll take care of you from there! See you next time.

Summary: We stayed three nights at the Bay Shores Hotel and really enjoyed it.  This is an older hotel and the room was very clean but had a slight "older" scent to it.  Other than that, it was clean and comfortable.  The staff members were VERY helpful and accommodating with suggestions for dinner and points of interest.  The free breakfast was very satisfying if you're not expecting too much and free parking was greatly appreciated.  I would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Happy New Year and thank you for coming to stay. I am glad that you appreciated the free parking (it can add quite a bit to the tab when it isn't can't it!) and that you found my staff to be of service.  Of all of the accommodations we offer, it is the onsite personnel I think to be the very best asset. Happy to hear that you'd stay again, I very much look forward to that!

Summary Heading: Easy access to the beach and Newport Pier
Summary: What a great find.  A charming well run boutique hotel less than 5 minutes from the beach and right next door to Marina Park.  Phenomenal view from rooftop deck.  Our room on the top floor had a partial ocean view. Warren and Jenn made the place feel like home.  Not a fancy resort but if you are looking for an easy, nice place where you have walking access to Newport Beach Pier and the ocean, this is a spot to consider.
Manager Response: It is a great view isn't it - Pacific Ocean to the front and the Channel to the rear, I never get tired of watching all there is to see! Thank you for your review, I appreciate you letting other folks know about our proximity to the beach and the pier and that we are a boutique hotel with a home from home feel. Hope that we get the pleasure of your company again one day, thank you for coming to stay.

Summary: This hotel has a lot of personal touches, including fresh flowers in the room. The rooftop deck is a great place to relax and take in the beach views. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a charming location with exceptional staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for mentioning my staff and the flowers - they are forever thinking of those extra little touches that make my guests feel welcome and at home! I hope you enjoyed Newport Beach while you were here and that the next time you need a place to relax, you'll consider staying again.

Summary Heading: A great property in great location
Summary: An older but real classic with personality spot across from beach and near everything - bike rentals, good eating spots, beach of course. Service, lobby area all good. Parking is a challenge but we managed and staff is excellent at helping you sort it out. Love this spot.
Manager Response: You know that saying that people start to look like their dogs? Well, I'm feeling a bit like my hotel, "older, but a real classic"! Anyway, thank you for the great review - yup, that parking can be a bit tight but we'll do whatever we can to help you out to include feeding the meter on the street if its just too much of a squeeze. Hope your retirement will allow you to come back soon!

Summary Heading: Best hotel of a 10 days trip
Summary: Close to the beach,  nice rooms, a lot of nice amenities like cookies, beach towels or bodyboards you can use, DVDs you can borrow. We wish we stayed longer to enjoy what this hotel had to offer. WiFi works great. And the peninsula is very very nice to visit, walk, run, surf etc
Manager Response: And we wish you could have stayed longer too! I do hope you'll be able to come back one day and make that happen; we'd love for you to have more time to enjoy everything Bay Shores and Newport Beach has to offer.  Thank you for the five star review!

Summary: Took a chance on a first-time two night stay in Newport Beach. I thought it was a bit pricey for a Sunday and Monday night in November but it was a better deal than other places. Lovely continental breakfast in a very small dining area (only three tables), free-wifi, books, DVDs, beach chairs and toys, 24-7 coffee and tea , free parking all included. We interacted with four of the front desk staff and each one was unfailingly nice and helpful. Family owned and run for 25 years. Right next door to a relatively new park and rec center where you can rent kayaks, do SUP and learn to sail. There is also a lovely little restaurant in the park with a great view of the marina. A small beach is located just behind the hotel. Walking distance to piers, shops, restaurants. Short car ride
Manager Response: We're delighted that you took a chance with us and enjoyed your stay, including all the great features of our new "Marina Park".  Thank you for mentioning our friendly and helpful staff, they all work hard at providing the best customer service in Newport Beach.

Summary: This quaint little hotel is conveniently located one block from the beach.  It is old school beach hotel.  I was a bit disappointed especially considering the price I paid for one night. There is a smell about the property that I just couldn't get past. I could smell it in my sleep.  My bed had sand in it, but at 1:00 AM who would change it?  I slept on top of the sheets. The pillows are old and lumpy.  My room was on the East side which meant the sun came shining in at 5:00 AM.  Not a problem if you have black out drapes or at least something more than just sheer drapes.  Four hours of stinky sandy sleep - I was not pleased.  I really try to keep reviews positive but this hotel just annoyed me.  Lack of sleep I guess.
Manager Response: Dear Cheeks,  I am truly sorry that you were your disappointed with your stay. We've checked your room and found black-out curtains in place and ready to use, I'm not sure how you missed them.  We could not identify any peculiar smell around the property, perhaps for someone from the desert it was our usual ocean or low tide smells prevalent at the beach?  We hope that you will try us again, we would love a 2nd chance to prove why we are #1 in customer satisfaction.     ---Fred Pratt

Summary: Great place and friendly staff. Cookies, breakfast, chocolates in pillow...great, neat c!one  to everything, even give you a place to park. They also have recommendations to local restaurants. Take the Newporter to get around
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, and yes, the free rides on the Newporter are the best way to move around the peninsula.  Next time you're down from Alaska we hope you'll look us up again.

Summary: This place was such great value for money. It felt just like Home.  The staff were so welcoming and helpful, nothing was to big or little.  The fact that breakfast was included was amazing - the bagels were lovely and fresh! The rooftop was nice to sit at for breakfast and a good view.  We were in room 304 for the first part of our visit - would definitely recommend it - beautiful views of marina AND beach.  The cookies made it feel like home and I ate soooo many!! All beach stuff was included and we were even able to borrow books for our bub to read.  The rooms were well cared for, and had a really lovely Newport vibe.  I have no other way to describe the rooms but quaint?  Anyway, don‚Äôt over look this place, loved every minute of staying here. Thanks for the lovely end to our
Manager Response: Thank you for that nice review and for looking us up all the way from Australia!  Thanks also for mentioning our small new children's library and games center, kids really enjoy making good use of it.  I hope you had a smooth and uneventful trip home!

Summary: Old school friendly hotel located less than 100m from the beach.  Staff were very friendly and helpful and the WiFi worked well.  Room was clean and very comfortable. Easy walking distance to central Newport Beach and some nice bars and restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for finding us all the way from England, and of course for that nice review.  I hope your return flight home was smooth and uneventful!

Summary: We decided to take a weekend trip at the last minute and we chose to call Bay Shore Inn. Luckily they had 1 room left.  We‚Äôve stayed her a couple of times before and the staff has always been friendly and helpful, this time was no different. The customer service is truly refreshing...a greeting card awaits upon your arrival and a ‚ÄúThank You‚Äù postcard once we were back home. Who does that anymore?   The room was nice a cozy, slightly musty due to weather, but once the a/c was on it was nice.  Note: there are 2 rooms that don‚Äôt have mini refrigerators in them, so be sure to confirm when you reserve.  A short walk across the street and you‚Äôre at the sandy beach.  Don‚Äôt forget to enjoy breakfast on the rooftop deck!   We love this place, can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Manager Response: We're glad you decided to make the trip out here from Phoenix, hope you had good trip home, and we also can't wait for you to come back!

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here one night and I wish we could have stayed here the whole trip! Warren was so welcoming, accommodating and informative! He had a great attitude and gave us coupons on the things we were wanting to do for our stay. The location couldn't have been better! We were across the street from the beach and were close to a lot of places. The hotel room was tidy, neat and clean. I liked that it didn't reek of bleach and cleaners like most larger chain hotels do. It was perfect for our one night stay with a fridge, hand written welcome note and even turn down service! Also hotel parking was FREE! The hotel provides you with all sorts of beach stuff such as beach towels, beach umbrellas, boogie broads, beach chairs, and more (also free). This hotel had
Manager Response: Thank you for those nice words!  We pride ourselves on our vintage beach hotel feel as well as our personal touches and old-fashioned service.

Summary: If you go to Newport Beach this is the place to stay, so warm and friendly. We had a lovely stay and with Warren baking cookies, what more could you ask for.  The room was so cute and lovely and very homely!  We would most definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for that "Wonderful" review!  I hope you had a safe and uneventful return trip to Southampton and that we'll see you when you again make it out to our California beaches.

Summary Heading: No surprise here, but the personal touch - - leaves you pleasantly speechless!
Summary: I ALWAYS rely on Trip Advisor reviews when traveling so when reading reviews for the #1 ranked hotel in Newport Beach - Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel, I knew exactly what I was getting.  However, you cannot express in words (very well - but I'll try) how wonderful it feels when your host (Jenny) apologizes that your room isn't ready for you (at our 9:30 am arrival - we didn't expect it to be) and then invites you to have some coffee, check out the roof-top deck (gorgeous view, pics posted here don't do it justice) and help ourselves to boogie boards, beach chairs, umbrellas and even towels so that we could enjoy the beach until our room was ready!  Not just that, but who offers to pay your parking meter fee if there isn't room to park in their parking lot?  Bay Shores Peninsula
Manager Response: Thank you, and we also certainly hope you're back enjoying Newport Beach soon!

Summary: Let's just say the reason that I booked this hotel in this location, was because of the reviews that it had received in the past. I was very pleasantly surprised to find that the reviews were 100% accurate!  Let's just say that both Donna and Warren, went out of their way to make our state and experience the best possible.  The room and its location were super clean! Enjoyed seeing basket of fruit and fresh flowers in the room daily. Breakfast was a sight for sore eyes‚Ä¶   Definitely will rebook this time and time again!  Thanks again- Dax
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning our cleanliness and customer service, we all work very hard to provide you with a 1st rate experience.

Summary Heading: Buck the chains when staying in Newport Beach/Irvine area
Summary: This place gets a solid 5 from me, not because it is the newest facility, but because it is clean, quaint and cozy; not because it has all of the standard chain hotel amenities but because it has "its own" amenities.  I enjoyed parking the car and walking everywhere for my stay-the hotel being situated between the marina and the ocean.   The smell of warm, freshly baked cookies and a friendly "hello" greeted my at check-in, and on the phone minutes before-since I had no advanced reservation.   A solid breakfast was included, as was a cheerful ready source of restaurant and activity suggestions.   The rooftop lounge area was a beautiful place to hang out anytime.   Beach chairs, bikes and boogie boards area available.  Heck the place still has postcards in the room--who does that
Manager Response: Thank you for that pat on the back.  This small family owned hotel has been bucking the act-alike and look-alike trend of the cookie-cutter chains for 55 years, my family for the past 37 years, and we're quite proud of it!

Summary: We had originally booked a two-night stay in Irvine, at a Hilton location (to be close to family we were visiting). Due to crappy circumstances with Hilton, we were pushed away and told to go to another hotel...in Newport Beach. They said they would pay for one of the nights since it was an inconvenience. When we arrived to the small Inn, we were told they were full, and then pushed down the road to Bay Shores (the third hotel/Inn). We received the last room and were taken care of. The gentleman was very nice and helpful. The room was quaint, though a bit small for myself, my wife, and my 2-1/2 year old son. We were on the bottom floor, so not having to use stairs was nice. Parking was pretty awful, as it was a major holiday weekend. The Inn only had 8 spaces on-site to offer
Manager Response: On the one hand I'm sorry you were bounced around by those other hotels, on the other hand we are delighted you found us and that you ended up having a nice Labor Day weekend.

Summary: Fantastic Staff, always helpful night or day. Location within easy walking distance of the beach, the pier, local restaurants and shops. Our room was very nice, clean and quiet. We flew in on a red eye and didn't make it to the hotel until 3:00AM, staff were waiting for us and made sure we got settled in quickly for some shut eye. Warm cookies in the afternoon and the delicious Pineapple and Cucumber infused water to wash it down!
Manager Response: Those red-eye flights can be a real bear.  I can't think of many better places to recover from that ordeal than on the beach in Newport Beach, and I'm glad you had a "Fantastic Stay".

Summary: Our short vacation was awesome from booking the room with Warren over the phone.  He is so helpful.   Check in was a breeze with Jenny.  We arrived as the afternoon cookies were coming out of the oven. Great timing!   They have loads of DVDs to play in your room, along with beach gear that you can borrow.   They also have a fabulous breakfast every day.  Our room was a one bedroom suite that we had stayed in before.   There is a Park across the street from the Hotel, which was a big hit with our three year old.  The Park is on the Bay.  It was a great vacation.    We look forward to our next trip to the Bay Shores.
Manager Response: We love greeting our return guests, much like welcoming old friends, and we value your continued patronage. I'm glad your 3 year old likes our new park, we'll be sure to keep some chocolate chip cookies warm for him too.

Summary: Staff at all levels are the very best the venue is spectacular.  I have been there twice in the last two months and will probably visit again end of this month.  Great breakfast, all you beach amenities are there for your use, sand chairs, umbrellas and towels.  The porch on top with the sunsets and the view of the bay and the ocean creme de la creme.
Manager Response: Thank you for that nice review, and a special thanks to you as one of our regular returning guests.  I also especially like the rooftop sun-deck in the evenings, turning to moon & stars-deck, or city lights-deck after nightfall.

Summary: Our second stay. Sitting on sun deck now. Great view of the ocean and the bay. Hotel is one block from each. Rooms are nice and clean. Old time elevator is cute and slow but it works. Nice breakfast area with lots of choices is included. The people are special. Ralph and Jennie could not be more helpful. Housekeepers very good. Hot cookies every afternoon. Loaner beach chairs and beach equipment. Senior citizen and AAA rates. Highly recommended
Manager Response: Thank you for that "Best" review, and especially for mentioning my special staff which works very hard to provide you with a comfortable and enjoyable visit to the beach.

Summary: The room was very nice. The service was outstanding!!! The front desk employees Warren, Donna and Jennifer were great. The hospitality was over the top!!! We would definitely stay here again. It's in a great location between the beach and peninsula!  Looking forward to staying here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning my fine staff.  And we also are looking forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: My wife and loved the warm, quaint atmosphere and the friendly helpful staff. There is a lot of attention paid to small details that make your stay very enjoyable: the fresh baked cookies in the afternoon, the library of books and DVDs, the daily newspaper, the selection of coffees, cereals and breads in the charming breakfast room and kitchen. We enjoyed the basket of fruit in our room and the selection of toiletries in the bathroom. The hotel was clean, well kept, with baskets of flowers everywhere. The well furnished rooftop patio has a nice view of Newport Bay. A blast from the past (check out the carpet pattern in the hallway by the old-fashioned elevator!), this hotel definitely makes you feel welcome!
Manager Response: Thank you for that very nice review.  Yes, we do like to consider ourselves as a "Blast from the Past".  It's been a small family owned hotel for its 55 years and we've tried to keep that 60s feel as well as the old-fashoned friendly and helpful customer service our guests deserve.

Summary: A great stay, as always. Our fourth stay at Bay Shores and we'll definitely visit again.   The room we had had two large windows (corner plot) and a good sized bed.   My only very slight reservation is that the carpet on the stairs looks a little worn and old fashioned now. That's really the only negative I can find, and it's not really a negative!
Manager Response: A special thanks to you for that very nice review and also for being one of our most loyal return guests. I hope your return to the United Kingdom was safe and uneventful. When you return to the States and Newport Beach, we hope to continue to provide you with accomodations and service worthy of a "Great, as always" review.

Summary: We were greated by Warren when we arrived and he made us feel right at home. It was almost like it was his house we were invited to. The hotel is very cosy and feels intimate and laid back. The rooftop terrace was amazing. We watched the sun set and enjoyed a glass of wine. They provide you with beach towels and all you would need for a fun day at the beach. You only have to walk across the street to be on the beach and only a few blocks to be where you will find shops and restaurants.. We will definitely recommend this place to everyone we know and if we come back this way again we will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for that very nice review.  I hope you had a safe and uneventful trip home to Italy, and we certainly hope you will come back again some time to visit.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay to enjoy Newport Beach
Summary: This is a well-run family-owned hotel that knows hospitality. The building is older--a sort of 50's throwback--but well-maintained, clean and modernized. From the fresh fruit, fresh flowers and welcome note in the room to the fresh-baked cookies every afternoon in the lobby to the excellent breakfast every morning, everything says "Welcome." The staff were very friendly, very knowledgable about the area and very helpful. Free use of the beach towels, chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards is a great bonus, and it's an easy one-block walk to the beach. Eat breakfast on the roof at least once.
Manager Response: You came a long way from Nebraska to the Pacific Ocean, and we're so glad you chose Newport Beach and our hotel for your stay.  Yes, its been a small family owned beach hotel for all of its 55 years, and we're proud to be a "throw-back" in not only looks but in our friendly and helpful customer service.

Summary: My family and I stayed at the Bayshores Peninsula Hotel for three days at the end of our Southern California vacation. It was the perfect place to relax after almost two weeks of constant activity.   The management was professional AND friendly. They were very solicitous and attuned to all our needs. The atmosphere was warm and friendly. The staff were helpful suggesting places to go and things to see.   The terrace on the roof afforded us the loveliest views of the sunsets. It's location is absolutely PERFECT! One block from the ocean and one block from the bay. They provide beach equipment and every day at three o'clock there were fresh baked cookies for the guests. There is even a library of books for children. My granddaughter loved going to the lobby to have me read a book
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning my wonderful staff and our various amenities (including our small new children's library and games center, which was recently added at the suggestion of one of my grandchildren).  For memories of our rooftop views, check our website for our live Surf-Cam of the 18th Street beach.

Summary Heading: What a welcoming place to come to after long ride
Summary: Out of the many years of staying in different places all over the US, this by far is the best hotel to stay in. I hardly ever write reviews but this is so well worth it.  The hospitality and warm welcoming was so nice especially driving through LA traffic.  The rooms are decorated so beautifully and cheery.  They are impeccably clean.  The people at the front desk in evening and also morning treat you like friends and family.  The food for breakfast was one of the best in a hotel.  They pay attention to detail and also add extra touches throughout hotel.  The location perfect.  I highly recommend this place to anyone coming this way.  You definitely won't be disappointed.  Thank you for the nice stay on our vacation. This hotel is a 5 +++ rating.
Manager Response: While you don't often write reviews, I do thank you for taking the time writing this one, and for the splendid recommendation.  I know writing reviews can be a chore and I appreciate your doing this for us!

Summary Heading: Stand-Out Guest Experience at the Bay Shores Peninsula
Summary: In the cookie cutter, everyone-is-alike world of hotels today, the Bay Shores Penisula is shining example of stand-out guest experience.  I don‚Äôt say that lightly, as I travel often, and am by vocation an experience architect.  A recent business trip found me needing to be in the Newport Beach area for several days. Desiring to extend my stay by a day in order to enjoy the area, and knowing I would be working long hours in the afternoon and evenings while in the area, I searched for a hotel that was close to the beach, provided my requirements for a comfortable work environment, and was easily accessible to the major roads in the area.  The Bay Shores Peninsula more than met all three of my requirements, and my initial encounter with the staff, followed by successive days, far
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an old-style beach hotel that will take you back to the 50's! While it is not modern, it has all the up-to-date conveniences like a refrigerator in your room, flat screen TV, free wireless, and DVD player. The staff really knocks themselves out to make you welcome and help with any needs. Free breakfast and freshly baked cookies in the afternoon! Great restaurants a short walk away. Roof-top deck. Bayside and ocean beaches both a half-block away. Did I mention beach chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards, and toys for the kids available? This is right in the heart of the action on a summer weekend--expect lots of people and street noise. Great people watching!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived and were immediately greeted with a smile and a fresh-baked cookie. The entire staff goes out of their way to make sure you have a wonderful stay. The room was great and the rooftop lounge is awesome for having a cocktail and admiring the view. The hotel has great location with easy access to the beaches and good restaurants within walking distance. Going forward, this is the only place I will stay in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect location for experiencing the beach at Newport Beach
Summary: We had just one night in Newport Beach as my spouse had a business lunch the next day.  We decided to skip the usual chain hotels and experience the beach in Newport Beach.  We were very happy with our decision to stay at Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel.  The location was just a block away from the beach and within walking distance of the pier with multiple restaurants and bars.  It also has a roof top deck from which you can see the beach and watch the activity.  Room was a little on the small side, but extremely clean and comfortable.  Service was excellent and parking is free.  Our only regret is that we did not make plans to stay longer.   We will definitely stay here again if we are back in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just returned from our stay at the Bay Shore Peninsula Hotel. Had a great time. Felt welcomed like family!  Warren was ever so helpful. From suggestions for fun, movie rental help and even changing the battery in the smoke detector!! The hotel location is great. Close to shops and restaurants. 7-11 around the corner. Bay side beach area and 2 blocks to ocean side and Beach.  Trolley stop is close by. Loved the roof top terrace. Spent my mornings there reading and drinking coffee.  We will definitely return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our 2017 Soul Sister Great Beach Getaway was a fabulous success, thanks in no small part to the incredible staff at this wonderful family owned boutique style hotel. Special thanks to Jenny, Ralph, Bruce, Donna, and last but certainly not least ... Warren along with their wonderful support staff.   From our favorite 2nd floor room, to fresh Orchids in the bathroom, to having two suitcase stands (even 5 star hotels only give you 1 of those!) the lovely free breakfast, the free use of beach chairs, umbrellas & beach toys, and the fact that it's just a block to the beach or the bay ... all makes this my 7th stay (in 2 years) at the Bayshores Peninsula Hotel the reason we keep coming back.   At a time when customer service seems on the decline in so many places, the Bayshores
Manager Response: We of course love our repeat guests and are glad to provide you with the service you deserve.  Thank you for the great review and your continuing patronage.

Summary: I made my reservation calling the hotel to go w my family for fun time there at the beach because my brothers and thier kids were there in some beach house they took and my kids want to stay w them but i stayed in hotel and we meet all day togather at my brother beach house.. so any way .. i got bruce on line he was very nice then i called again to updated my reservation adding another night and got donna on line.. this lady is so so so sweet.. when i checked in i met warren and he went w me through every thing in hotel where to go and even he gave me his parking spot ..so nice thank u warren ..any how i knew that donna works at midnight so i went to her to say hi .. i loved her she was very nice and she was happy telling me  to wake up  in the  morning  to try the croissant she
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning my great staff.  And yes, believe me, being a small hotel I am very well aware of each of my wonderful staff and the excellent customer service they provide!

Summary: From your first impression at check-in, you can feel the charm and attention to detail that carries through out the hotel. If you think that traffic is bad in Socal try finding a parking space, the hotel provides free parking. Just across the street from the beach makes for easy walk.
Manager Response: Yes, traffic and parking can be problems down here, especially in the summer.  Best bet is to park in our free lot then walk to the many nearby beaches, Newport Pier commercial area, restaurants, shops and other Peninsula attractions, most within an easy 5-10 minute walk.  I'm glad you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: We enjoyed very much the hotel during a few days and felt very warmly welcomed. Everything was clean and designed to make you feel welcomed. The cookies are great and breakfasts also. The location is extremely good to enjoy Newport, the harbor and the beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for that very nice review.  I hope you had an enjoyable and uneventful return trip to France.  Should you return to our area we would look forward to welcoming you again.

Summary: We spent 3 nights there and thoroughly enjoyable experience. Great service from Jenny, Warren and Ralph. They were there for anything you needed or any questions. Restaurants, directions, help wot boarding passes and anything. Third floor rooms away from Busy street recommend. Highly Recommended. Newspaper at your door in AM, nice continental breakfast. Lots of amenities including a windshield squeegee and water etc, like in gas station. !!!!!!! Thanks Staff
Manager Response: Thanks for that great review and especially for mentioning my great staff.  I hope you had a pleasant trip back to Scottsdale (with a clean windshield).

Summary: This is our third timing staying here in the past 5 years and it never disappoints! We flew into John Wayne and didn't have a car (you really don't need one if you're doing a beach weekend). We ate lunch and popped in to see if we could get some beach equipment. It was before check in and we explained our situation. Jenny at the front desk was so friendly and accommodating. She said we could get towels and whatever else we wanted for the beach. Then she checked on our room and said it would be ready in a few minutes. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel has a great breakfast, roof top balcony with comfortable furniture, fruit available throughout the day, warm cookies in the afternoon, free DVDs to watch in your room, free parking, free newspaper, nice toiletries and
Manager Response: I'm glad we were able to accomodate your early check-in and that you were able to explore our local beach community.  We too hope to have you back this summer!

Summary: I have relatives who live in this area and I was looking forward to staying at Bay Shores again for the second year running, this time for two weeks.  I wasn't disappointed. I actually had one of the rooms I had stayed in the year before and it was just as clean, comfortable and cosy as I remembered.  This is a hotel which offers fresh flowers and fruit in rooms, chocolates left on the bed at night, a newspaper every day, DVDs to borrow, and beach equipment.  It is excellently situated about two minutes from the beach, a few minutes from the pier, and next to a park and the harbour. There's a convenience store just down the road.  The hotel provides breakfast, and this year added freshly baked croissants to the variety of food available.  (one small point, the yoghurts still
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning my friendly and helpful staff, they all take great pride in their outstanding customer service.  And yes, I also hope we can find you a room for your next visit, booking early and directly with us will help ensure it.

Summary: We arrived at 11am, our room was ready.  Warren was so hospitable, let us know about the great continental breakfast (including hard boiled eggs, bagels, hot and cold cereal, fruit, different breads for toasting, croissants etc etc, the fabulous rooftop deck you can bring your own food and beverage to, chairs, towels, boogie boards to borrow for the beach.  Fresh fruit and bottled water in the room.  Large DVD collection to borrow from.  Cute beachy decor in the room, free parking in the hotel lot.  Wonderful
Manager Response: Breakfast on our rooftop sundeck watching the boats in the bay to the east or the ocean surf to the west is my favorite also.  Evenings up there with a glass of wine at sunset isn't so bad either.

Summary: Travelled to New Port in September 2016, found this place rated #1 on Trip Advisor and decided this would meet our families needs. From the initial check in and warm cookies for the kids it was a pleasurable stay.  The hotel is located 1 block from the beach and an ideal location to Balboa Island as well.  We ate our continental breakfast daily on the roof top, which was quite quiet and relaxing for wife/kids and myself.  When you make your trip to the beach the hotel has toys/skim boards for your use which is a nice option as well.  The hotel has a great staff doing cleaning and always seem pleasant and willing to help if you need anything done.  Our room was spotless even considering us being at the beach (sand) and our kids just being kids.   I would stay here again for sure!
Manager Response: I love it when families stay with us.  The kids are always so excited to get to the beach, either the ocean for the surf or our calm bay beach for the little ones.  Then they're usually hanging out at 3 pm waiting for the warm chocolate chip cookies.  Lots of fun.  Thank you for mentioning our maids and the great job they do!

Summary: Visiting Newport Beach area for a niece's wedding.  My wife found the Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel through TripAdvisor.  So many reviews have called out how attentive and helpful everyone at the hotel is, and the reviews don't lie.  Depending on when you check in you may be greeted by fresh baked cookies.  Just 1/2 block from the beach and walking distance to most of the top rated restaurants.  They have a roof deck with great views of bay and ocean.  Although a little cold and windy the weekend I visited it would otherwise be a wonderful place to share a glass of wine with friends or family.  Don't often get to this area but would return to Bay Shores without hesitation.  The almost unanimous 5 star reviews are a completed fair assessment.  Hoping your stay was as pleasant as
Manager Response: Weddings are always such happy times, I'm glad we were able to have you share that special weekend with us.  Let me know when you're back in town and I'll try to order up some better weather.

Summary Heading: It  would be 6 stars if I could - how hotels SHOULD be
Summary: From the outside, this looks like a typical American motel, even down to the interior courtyard/car park with overlooking verandas. But looks can be deceiving, the Bay Shores Peninsula as something special  Even checking in, it's clear that the owners are determined  that their levels of service should stand out - and they do. The room  rate also includes a buffet breakfast, which you can eat in the breakfast area, on the veranda outside your room, or why not on the rood terrace. Yes, they have a terrace right on the top of the hotel from which  you have views over the surrounding areas, marina and sea  On the first night we returned to find we also get a turn-down, with chocolate. Even most hotels have given up on this little nicety,so it was a great surprise in a motel
Manager Response: Yes, California beach hotels built 55 years ago do have that certain exterior look, don't they?  That's why we do everything possible inside to provide all the modern amenities you've kindly noted, while trying to preserve our vintage surfing vibe.  I'm glad you had a nice stay!

Summary: Got the 2 room suite for family that overlooked the bay with it's own balcony and it was perfect.  Kitchen is ready for visiting families with dishes & utensils.  Kids had there own room.  Room was bright, cheery and clean, thank you for the bed time chocolates. Cheers to Warren and Donna they are both very helpful, friendly and have great recommendations for where to eat and things to do.  Don't have to pack extra beach towels & beach toys they have it all, even beach umbrellas.  Breakfast is a nice selection and they will even help you make a to go bag if your flight is real early in the morning.  Thank you for a wonderful vacation, sorry it wasn't longer.  Liked looking at the roof top camera before we arrived for our vacation.  Can't wait to come back.  Perfect place to stay
Manager Response: Thank you for that nice review and for your kudos for my great staff.  I'm glad you found our rooftop surf-cam, it's a great way to check live beach and surf conditions from your easychair.  We look forward to seeing you on your return.

Summary: The staff are so kind here and they pay attention to every detail. They were so helpful. They place is so clean and they go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable. I called to see if room was available sooner and it was. If there is no parking spots left they will pay your meter for you. Welcome card on the bed when we arrived. Fresh fruits in the room daily.
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning the awesome job my entire staff performs.  They are deservedly proud of keeping your room and the entire property shipshape, and for their friendly and helpful customer dervice.

Summary Heading: Fabulous location, and excellent  facilities and welcoming  staff .
Summary: Excellent Hotel in Newport with location close to restaurants , pier and beach. WE enjoy a good walk, range of restaurants and a few bars and we were able to do it all from here . Welcome chat from Warren  on local community, restaurants , thinks to do parking etc excellent and homemade cookies on arrival  Double room was a good size and had a real,beach club feel to it with striped walls, surfing pictures and a nautical bathroom with lots of toiletries , bath/ shower and plenty of mirrors for make up and shaving. Coffee facility in the room and a fridge for water and drinks. Roof top area with seats where you get a 360 view of The bay and the peninsula and ideal for a pre dinner drink as you can take your own up with you..  Breakfast in the mornings plenty of varieties of
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just returned from our second stay at Bay Shores. It was just as great as the first time. Great location on the peninsula. Close to the beach and restaurants. We were there for a week and did nothing more than relax and eat. Car stayed in the same spot for the entire time. We love the roof top patio for ocean views and breezes. Warren and the rest of the crew are great hosts. Can't go wrong. Will definitely return on our next visit to California from Alabama.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Choose this place over the fancy big hotels
Summary: My room was perfectly clean and full of local charm. While not really large, it was enough. Overlooking the new Marinapark and up-bay views was not anticipated, but fully enjoyed. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable about the local community. The views from the top deck are AWESOME! Truly fabulous eateries are in walking distance. Over a weekend, this is important. Keep your parking spot, and walk to the Crab Cooker, The Cannery, The Porch, 21 Oceanfront, Charlie's Chili, etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was perfect. The coolest dude checked us in - Warren I think was his name -  he seemed like he‚Äôd done this all his life and still loved every second of it. There are amazing flowerbeds everywhere in the courtyard. Our room on the, second down the hall. Giant, wall-sized painting of a surfer. With its own special lighting. Amazing. Fresh fruit in the room, radio on upon arrival, doesn't get any better! Walking distance to the pier and great restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Returner but this time in a wheelchair.
Summary: I just love this place.    It is a small privately run establishment which does a great job of welcoming its guests most of whom seem to be either returners or first timers who suggest they will be back.    It is situated one road from the beach however the distance to the beach is not much farther than the distance from the sand to the waters edge.       The beach was easily accessible in the wheelchair and the beach line has a paved broadwalk for pedestrians, skaters and cyclists.    Although quite busy everyone showed respect and courtesy and it was a really pleasant wheel.      The hotel offer loans of boards, chairs beach towels and buckets and spades. All you need for a great day out on the beach  At 15:00 every day there are fresh cookies and coffee in reception the smell
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a good experience with this hotel:  (1.) Awesome staff who was super helpful.  They know the area very well and gave us excellent suggestions.  (2.) Price is reasonable.  (3.) Location is excellent.  (4.) Rooms are nice and were very clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location a block from the beach, superb service - feels like a family owned hotel with people who really care about your experience, a lovely rooftop patio with beautiful views, complimentary breakfast, really reasonable prices for the area. I purposely book my Southern California work trips between San Diego and L.A. to be able to spend a night here. Early morning and sunset walks on the beach, plus plenty of dining options in walking distance make this a perfect work or vacation spot
Manager Response: none

Summary: 2 couples shared a 2 bedroom suite and really saved $. We walked the 2 blocks to the beach and later to dinner on the bay. The staff is very accommodating and helpful. The breakfast was a great money saver too. Yes the rooms are a bit outdated but for the price this hotel can't be beat. We will stay here again. Also, I loved that the bedrooms had good reading lamps.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A mix-up at another hotel led me to Bay Shores at 11pm one night.  Luckily they had a room and they took great care of me.  Donna got me checked in efficiently and was great.  Loved the room and the sunrise out my window the next morning was stunning.  Great location too.  Hope to return!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice place.  Rooms are clean, staff helpful & accommodating.  They offer breakfast and free parking.  Within walking distance (2 blocks) of the Newport Beach American Legion hall.  Our room was on the Balboa Blvd side and the traffic noise was a bit much if we wanted to leave the windows open.  We had to close them and turn on the air conditioning to sleep.  A four night stay was just over $750 which is pretty reasonable for Newport Beach and place that's a block from the ocean.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic property and so close to the beach
Summary: I found this hotel online and I will return here again and again. Only one block from the beach and 5 minutes to great restaurants. The service was spectacular - warm cookies in the lobby every afternoon! The room was very comfortable and the surf decor was awesome. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. A terrific experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Our new favorite place at the beach!
Summary: From the great location, affordable price, rooftop patio with awesome 360 degree views, free movies, and helpful staff, to satisfying breakfast, endless coffee, and cookies at 3 pm, what more can you ask for? We look forward to coming back again and again and bringing our family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I‚Äôve stayed here a few times and have always been impressed with the amazingly friendly service ‚Äì my most recent visit was no exception.  The Bayshores is also very centrally located on the Newport Beach peninsula ‚Äì it‚Äôs perfect for a visit to the beach.  The hotel itself is a bit dated and there is some room for improvement on the breakfast which is quite basic.  The cookies available every afternoon are much appreciated though!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here two years ago and it was great. This time I noticed the facility has definitely declined. The room wasn't as nice. The sauna didn't work. There was paper debris in the hot tub. Overall I was disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Cynthia,  I'm afraid you've reviewed the wrong property. We have no sauna and have never had one. We have no hot tub and have not had one for at least 10 years.  Our numerous recent reviews clearly show that our property has not declined. I'm sorry you had a poor experience wherever it was you actually stayed. ---Fred Pratt, Owner

Summary: My stay was great!!  Decor was super awesome - surf wallpapers, aquatic life and birds theme based soap bars and toiletries. Loved the place and the views of the ocean and back bay.  Jenny, Ralph and Donna were super nice, super friendly and super helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Here we are again at our VERY favorite place!!
Summary: Bay Shores Peninsula is a sweet haven in SoCal! The location is the perfect place for us to stay when we visit our high school teacher daughter. Have chosen this property time and time again! It sits on the Balboa Peninsula with the bay on one side and beach across the street, within 5 minutes walk. This little boutique hotel is family owned; it's very small; very clean, and has a very adequate breakfast! Even though it is an older property, we think it is very lovely! Oh, and the staff is very helpful!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: YOU CAN'T GO WRONG STAYING HERE!
Summary: Everyone at this establishment is beyond professional and friendly. It is one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. We stayed for 6 nights and not one thing took place that made us regret our choice. Front desk crew (Ralph, Warren and Jennifer) was delightful and knowledgeable. Room staff and maintenance crew are friendly and good at what they do. The rooftop lounge is a neat place to just kick back and enjoy the view. Breakfast is easy and plentiful and the afternoon cookies are super yummy. Love having the table outside the room on the balcony. The owner should be very pleased and appreciative of his staff. Stayed mid December 2016. Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  The staff went above and beyond my expectations.  I called the hotel because our travels took longer than anticipated and we were worried about parking late at night.  Warren, the Front Desk Person ensured me that they would assist us with our parking needs when we arrived.  There was one space left at the hotel parking lot when we arrived late at night.  Warren greet us warmly and explained that they had 2 other parking spots that weren't evident on arrival and the various parking restrictions around the area, also if we had to park at a meter on the street that the hotel personnel would feed the meter for us at the hotel's cost - that was totally amazing (since no other hotel in the world that we stayed at ever offer this
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed three nights. One block to beach and nice boardwalk. Friendly and helpful staff pushing home baked cookies on you, so expect to gain weight ;) You can rent dvds and they will pop popcorn for you. Town is small and not super interesting, but beach walking was nice and there are plenty vacation rentals to admire on the beach. Breakfast was not my favourite, with mainly starchy and sugary foods. There were hard boiled eggs though.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just spent two nights at the Bay Shores Pen. Hotel, and will stay there again. The staff was very friendly and courteous, the room was clean and comfortable. For us, the location was also very good. Fresh fruit in the room daily, continental breakfast in the mornings, and fresh cookies at 3pm
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good value including continental breakfast....bedding is substandard , limited parking.  Peninsula traffic can be bad, especially during the summer months.Forgot some clothes & they mailed them to me! How many hotels do u know would do that?
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A comfortable hotel that is like being home
Summary: This is one of the best small hotels that I have ever stayed at.  The rooms are comfortable and, as someone else has said, like your bedroom at home.  The staff are all friendly and very helpful.  The breakfast is abundant and excellent.  Cozy and warm would be two words that best describe Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My Wife and I had a great one night stay in December.   Our plan was to see the Christmas boat parade since the bay is a block away and the view from the roof top lounge would be good as well.   Unfortunately bad weather made us scrap that plan after a couple of minutes.   The next day was perfect winter beach weather and it made up for it.  The hotel is very conveniently located a couple of short blocks to the beach and only a little farther to the Newport pier with its multiple food options.   The Crab Cooker is my absolute favorite crustation cookery.      Once we parked the car (no charge) there was no reason to drive as the island is very walker friendly.   There is a small park across the street with play equipment for the kids.      While being located on the main street
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at this property one other time but that time we really did not explore the area or use the amenities of the hotel.  This visit we had the pleasure of spending more time in the area and have come to fully appreciate the hospitality and services provided.    Location:  The location is simply the best.  The beach, the bay, and wonderful restaurants and shops are all in walking distance.    Parking: The parking is on site or in the city lot next door, couldn't be more safe and convenient.  Value:  We were able to comfortably sleep two adults and three adult size man-teens in one of the family suites, Room 211.  Everyone was happy and we were not  stepping over one another!  The breakfast was not fancy but plentiful!  Cold cereal, hot cereal, bagels, hard boiled eggs,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My favorite little hotel! Just marvelous!!!!
Summary: Our one night stay was entirely pleasant!  Charming, clean, comfy and perfectly located between the harbor and ocean!  Great getaway for families or couples.  The staff was over the top pleasant, friendly and helpful!  Freshly baked cookies at 3pm, 24/7 coffee and tea, plentiful and nutritious free breakfast!  Free Wi-Fi, free parking, comfy beds, dvds, books and roof-top deck.  I highly recommend this little gem of a hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place was passed over by time. You walk into a lobby with fresh baked cookies.  The two owners give you a welcome card and a tour. The place is spotless and like a beautiful home atmosphere.  The rooms are like bedrooms not hotel rooms.  The beds are so comfortable if you lay down your gonna take a nap.  The forth floor is an open area to watch the sunset or sunrise or just chill. They have free DVD's but who needs that your within walking distance of town shopping and the best restaurants in Newport.  They have free beach toys; chairs boogie boards everything a local would use at your disposal.  Your minutes away from the best beaches in Southern California.   Don't waste your money thinking more stars on a hotel will be better. I never do less than 4 stars normally but
Manager Response: I'm so glad that you had a terrific stay! Nothing gives us more pleasure than being able to extend our hospitality in a home away from home atmosphere.  I do hope you'll be able to come stay again, thank you for taking the time to leave your review.

Summary Heading: The warmest welcome and a homely vibe
Summary: We stayed 3 nights at the end of several weeks of travel in the USA in order to catch our breath before heading home to NZ.     It proved to be the perfect choice.   A slight step back in time with the decor and room, but that added to the vibe. Our room was comfortable with all we needed including free wifi, a fridge and coffee machine and the added touch of fresh fruit , welcome card and chocolate.    Rumpety old lift when taking the luggage, otherwise stairs. Breakfast included which is self help.   We recommend loading the tray and climbing the several flights of stairs to the roof top where you can settle back and soak in the morning with views to the boat harbour on one side and the ocean on the other. Ideal location for walking the boardwalk and general pottering .   Good
Manager Response: Glad you had a great trip and that my hotel could the final stop on your US vacation. Thank you for recommending the rooftop for breakfast and the boardwalk for 'pottering' - two of my favorite things to do! I hope you had a safe return home, I look forward to hosting you the next time you come over.

Summary Heading: Excellent Staff, Hotel and Location...you will not be dissapponted!
Summary: FIVE STARS FOR A REASON!  This review is long overdue.  In October we held my 40th birthday event at the Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel and it was such a wonderful choice for us and all of our guests who flew in from all over the country to help celebrate.  The Manager Ralph and all of their staff (special shout-out to Warren) were so incredibly helpful in all of the planning and arrangements for our entire party.  Everyone was surprised with just how charming, clean and centrally located this wonderful boutique hotel is and we have all been talking about taking another trip back to the Bay Shores again soon!  I have stayed here many times myself and I simply cannot say enough good things about it.     The view from the roof top deck is one of the best I have seen and the California
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning them, but I tell you, I never take those stars for granted.  I am delighted you had such a wonderful stay - I can only than my wonderful staff for that.  I was thrilled to read that you had chosen us to spend your birthday with us - we'd ve happy to be part of any future celebrations!

Summary Heading: A very pleasant experience at the Bay Shores Penninsula Hotel
Summary: We called the hotel to find out more about it only a week or so before our trip to Newport Beach.  We spoke to a staff member named Warren who was very charming, professional, and generous with his time in talking with us.  He answered all our questions and was very informative.  So we reserved our 2-night stay.  When we arrived, Warren happened to be the staff person at the front desk.  He continued over the course of our stay to be very helpful in giving us useful information about the hotel and the vicinity.  At various times, we parked in the hotel parking lot or the adjacent street.  Both were convenient locations.  We had wanted a room with 2 beds, but at the late notice that we reserved, there were none in the main building.  So we booked a room in the secondary building
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review and for mentioning the benefit of reserving early.  As a small boutique hotel, with a faithful following, we are often completely booked, but here's a tip.  Even if you think we are full on a particular date, we do sometimes get a cancellation and my terrific front desk staff can always aprise if that's the case. I'm glad you had a nice stay, and I look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Last weekend (Oct. 28 thru Oct 31) we stayed at the Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel in Newport Beach. Our daughter was being married close by. My husband and I have stayed in many hotels in the U.S., Mexico and Europe. This hotel had it all. If you're looking for someone to carry your tennis racket through the lobby or fluff your lawn chair, this isn't the place for you. But if you want a small hotel with comfort and a lot of personality, stay here, and the room rates are very reasonable. The hotel is very cute with a lot of interesting decor. Everything has been carefully planned and thought out for the comfort of the guests. They serve freshly baked cookies at three o'clock. They have a continental breakfast that's quite good: lots of coffee, rolls, cereals, fruit, etc.. The rooms
Manager Response: I am always delighted when a small detail or appointment gets noticed by our guests!  We spend considerable time monitoring hospitality trends and those little 'dimmers", well, guests asked and we responded! If you have any other suggestions, please wing them our way.  It's because of guest comments that we provide pillow top mattresses, fragrance free toiletries and gluten free breakfast items! Thank you for coming to stay and I hope we have that pleasure again very soon.

Summary: Excellent!! Great location, friendly & helpful staff. My husband and I had a wonderful stay. Rooms are clean comfortable and quaint. The open air rooftop deck offers an amazing view of Newport Beach and surrounding harbor.
Manager Response: What a nifty emoji - very Newport Beach! Thank you for coming to stay and for the nice reviews.

Summary: My husband and I stayed at your hotel on October 1, 2016 to celebrate my husband's birthday. The service was excellent with the best hospitality from the wonderful staff. Special thanks to ANDREW who called me to let me know that the hotel had a last minute cancellation. I've tried for several days prior to book a room for my husband's birthday with negative results. Andrew was very professional. When we arrived, WARREN checked us in. He is very professional, friendly, and knowledgeable in answering all of our questions. He made us feel so comfortable.Other than mentioned, we have stayed there in August and September 2016 and Jenny and Ralph have also helped up. They were great as well!
Manager Response: Thank you for your tenacity and I'm so glad that my staff followed up with you and that you could come celebrate with us! As one of our regulars, I hope we get to see you very soon and that we get the pleasure of checking you in again!

Summary: our room was perfect. The right size & in a fantastic location - access to the beach and nearby to venues we were visiting. The staff were family! Ralph, Warren, others... always ready to answer a question & offer helpful suggestions and directions. loaning gear we didn't have was fantastic!
Manager Response: You're now part of our family too! Hope we get to see you again, come have another 'awesome' experience soon!

Summary: Great place to stay. Short walk to the ocean. Great location next to a park. Very well maintained property with attention to detail and the focus on guests. Hospitality students should come here to see how it's done! The staff is welcoming and warm, there's always housekeeping or maintenance, landscaping or general staff around the building so it feels extra safe and secure. Cookies in the afternoon and breakfast (you can eat it on the rooftop deck) in the am. Beach gear: umbrellas, chairs, toys, towels, boogie boards are provided during your stay. Parking was no problem and if the obvious spaces are full the staff will help you find a spot. There's even a squeegee in the parking lot to clean your windshield! Attention to detail!  The only changes I would make (which are totally
Manager Response: Thank you for coming to stay and for making such good suggestions! We are always looking for ways to make our guests stays even more pleasant.  Glad you enjoyed your time with us and for writing us such a great review.

Summary: Any prospective hoteliers would do well to visit this hotel. Although not luxourious, everything here is just so: Front of desk is excellent, friendly and informative. Rooms and bathrooms are scrupilously clean. Parking is available, location next to the beaches, park and marina is excellent. There is free hire all things needed for the beach and there is free cable and dvds. There are tables and a light outside each room and limitless coffee throughout the day. There are even free fresh baked cookies each day. There is also a rooftop terrace. In all, this is how a hotel should be and is one of the best we have stayed in. When we arrived back in the UK, we found a hand written postcard from the hotel thanking us for out custom: Sheer class! Highly recommended. Michael, Nottingham
Manager Response: I'm often asked to share the secrets of Bay Shores' success but there are really no secrets to share. Just hire staff who delight daily in the privilege of being in the hospitality business.  I am so happy that you got to experience their delight - guests like you are why we are all here!

Summary: This was a first time visit at Newport Beach and the hotel was very helpful. They are located 1 block away from the beach. The hotel will let you check out towels, chairs, and umbrellas for your short walk to the beach.  The decor is nautically inspired and they serve breakfast and have snacks later on in the day.  The person that checked us in directed us to some quality restaurants as well as showing us how to travel around town without driving, they were very helpful.
Manager Response: We love our first timers because we know it's the start of many, many more great times together.  Looking forward to the next one!

Summary: Check-in and check out was easy and quick. Staff was very helpful with suggesting places to see and restaurants. Free breakfast, bowls of fruit in rooms, turn down service with chocolates and fresh baked cookies in the afternoon made stay extra special. Over 300 DVD movies that could be checked out and watched for free. This was our first trip to Newport Beach but will not be our last.
Manager Response: Glad you had a great stay and hope we'll have the pleasure of your company again! I'll be passing your compliments on to my terrific staff who were responsible for your great review.

Summary: Another visit to Newport Beach and back to Bay Shores... We look at other places and for value, location and amenities we keep coming back.  Clean rooms, friendly staff, good breakfast, evening cookies and coffee always on.  Grab a beach chair, towel and maybe a boogie board. Head across the street for short walk to the beach. Parking can be tricky as limited spaces on site.  Staff is very helpful in assisting with parking.
Manager Response: What a privilege for a business to have return guests!  Thank you for letting others know what keeps you coming back and thank you for your loyalty to Bay Shores.

Summary: Stay was a three-day post-reunion nostalgia hiatus. Grew up in Orange County and spent many a summer day body surfing in Newport Beach in the 50s. The hotel was an excellent place to stay. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms small but clean and well-appointed. A continental breakfast is served daily. They also provide free beach equipment (chairs, towels, umbrellas and boogie boards) for guest use. Ideally situated between the bay and ocean with good bathing beaches at both. Good restaurants are within walking distance, including my wife's and I old handout - the Crab Cooker.
Manager Response: You can't beat The Crab Cooker can you!  So glad to have provided our share of happy memories for your return to Newport Beach.  Thank you for choosing us for your special reunion.

Summary: Room was great. People were great. Location was great! What else is there to say. I know you want more but this is it. You will enjoy your stay. I think people would enjoy short responses. You require to much in the response. This will be my last review.
Manager Response: You've said it all in just a few words - but thank you for those few! Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with others.

Summary: This hotel is right in the heart of Newport Beach.  To the west you are steps away from the beach, and to the right you are steps away from the bay.  The room was nice with a view of the ocean.  They have chairs, towels and beach gear you can use.  Good amenities and the people were very friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for coming to stay; glad that you were pleased with our location and amenities!

Summary: Bay Shores is a cute, quaint property on Balboa Blvd. The beach is literally across the street, and they'll loan you chairs, umbrellas, towels, etc. It's so nice to just grab your stuff and head across the street and not have to worry about parking or carrying your stuff really far. It's a cute place with great staff, and it's easy to walk around to restaurants and bars. Mutt Lynch's and Baja Sharkeez are two good beach-y places to eat and drink that are close, so it makes for a relaxing, laid-back place to stay. I would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed our community's laid back atmosphere and my hotel's vibe.  Always happy to welcome back return guests so look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: Although the facility is not a 5 start hotel (no restaurant, no spa, small rooms, basic bathrooms) the 5 star rating given by most reviewers is deserved because of the excellent customer service.  We arrived at 1am and Bruce came out to help us find a parking spot, checked us in, helped us to the room, etc.  The room was basic with a little traffic noise from the street, but it was clean and had a large flat screen tv, mini-fridge stocked with bottled water, coffee maker, and cd player pre-loaded with ambient music.  Buffet breakfast next morning was well-stocked, and not just carbs.  A few protein options such as hard boiled eggs, yogurt, and breakfast sandwiches.  Fresh baked cookies in the afternoon make the place very inviting after a day out.  The rooftop deck has fabulous
Manager Response: Firstly thank you so much for coming to stay and secondly, thank you for highlighting why so many of our guests give us "Five Stars". While we may not have those amenities you referenced (spa, restaurant), each day my staff and I are proud to provide what we believe to be the most important amenity of all - wonderful service.

Summary: This hotel is perfect for just keeping your car parked and walking everywhere. Great park for kids next door, beach is very short walk, and many restaurants close by. The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for coming to stay and for telling others about your "fun vacation"!

Summary: We visited Bay Shores 8 years ago so we're a little apprehensive as to wether it had stood the test of time.  We needn't have worried, we arrived I booked and we were so well looked after. You are really made to feel valued.  The rooms are clean and bright, the daily service and turn down was really welcome and the breakfast was nice.  This isn't a fancy hotel and it isn't cheap but the location and service make it such good value.   Check out the lighthouse cafe for breakfast or dinner, it's just a cross he park and food / service are excellent.  The only downside to our visit was the construction going on across the road. They are building a new Girl Guides centre and started work at 7am which wasn't ideal.  If you are looking for somewhere in Newport area then this hotel is
Manager Response: So glad that you came back after eight years and that Bay Shores had stood the test of time. Sorry about that early start on the construction across the street;  I'll have my Manager check out the site permit just to make sure that their eagerness to begin their day isn't counter to our City's desire to have our visitors enjoy the beginning of theirs!

Summary Heading: A Fun Find in Newport Beach
Summary: We just finished our second stay at the Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel in Newport Beach, California.  We were looking for a place to stay that is near the beach, good restaurants and other local points of interest.  The Bay Shores was perfect for all of these.  Our room was clean and comfortable with an East Coast feel.  I really recommend room 304 if it is available. The roof of the hotel is open and gives you a 360Àö view of the surrounding area. There are comfortable chairs, loungers and tables with umbrellas.  This is a perfect place to enjoy the hotels included breakfast or to take in the sunset in the evening.  Beach gear, from boards to beach towels, are available for all guests.  Parking is included and very convenient.  Your first impression might be the wonderful smell of
Manager Response: Thank you so much for coming to stay for leaving us such a great review! I do hope that you will come to stay again; I can guarantee that the "helpful attitudes" and the "wonderful smell of freshly baked cookies" will be waiting to welcome you back!

Summary Heading: Quaint and beach vibby hotel stay
Summary: We stayed in the Bay Suite for a family vacation.  There were three adults and three tweens.  The location in Newport was just excellent...walk across the street and the beach awaits.  Parking can be tricky but we found the staff ready to help us avoid ticket situations.   Our suite (2 bedroom-2 bath) was perfectly suited for us.  It was nicely decorated with black-out curtains and comfy beds and bedding.  Housekeeping does an excellent job. We found this hotel to be perfect for our two trips to Disneyland...only a 25 minute drive to Anaheim.   If you haven't been to Newport Beach, it is very clean and not crowded.  We all enjoyed the beach equipment we could check out, including chairs, towels, toys, and boogey boards.   Cons:  street parking can be tricky but staff helps; a
Manager Response: Thank you so much for mentioning our proximity to Disneyland and how uncrowded and clean you found Newport Beach. Great suggestion on the crockpot, I'll certainly consider that idea and for complimenting my "friendly & caring" staff.  Hope we can host you again!

Summary: This was our second stay and we were welcomed warmly by Warren, he makes you feel right at home.  The rooms give you the feel of the beach, good size room including "frig" and small safe, comfortable beds, very clean and a great housekeeping staff. Rooftop is a great place to enjoy your continental breakfast in the morning.  Parking can be difficult but the staff goes out of their way to help so it becomes a non-issue. We love this place and it's the only hotel we'll stay at in Newport Beach.
Manager Response: I love the rooftop for breakfast too - can't beat those views! Thank you for giving us that "Best in Newport" title to your review; until your return, we'll keep working hard to earn and deserve such accolades!

Summary: My wife and I stayed at this hotel over the Fourth of July weekend.
