Yes, the roadside rooms are prone to traffic noise, but I‚Äôm a very light sleeper and I can honestly say I was not kept awake by traffic. Nor did I ever hear anything from neighboring rooms. The AC unit, however, is very loud. TV programming is by way of satellite and TVs are HD. Wifi worked great. The cleaning staff relocated almost everything I left on the bathroom. I think they were trying to tidy things up but it made me crazy and the stuff they moved wasn‚Äôt any tidier, just in a different spot. I actually had to open cupboards to try to find some items. (Note to housekeeping: sometimes people put things where they
Manager Response: Thank you for your review; we particularly value comments from our business travelers. I've asked my maintenance crew to check out the AC in your room for noise and the hairdryer to see if it has become a little 'tired'! The room safes are meant for smaller personal items, but with more and more folks (not just business travelers) bringing along 'tech items, it's a good note and  I'll look into what is becoming the industry standard.  As with all guest comments, we'll be discussing yours at our weekly meeting, so thank you for all your observations.

Summary: Stayed three nights there - this last weekend..  Very nice and clean with friendly staff.  Close to Beach (altho that wasn't why we were there). Beds and pillows very comfortable.  House cleaning staff was very nice and dia grnd job on cleaning the room.  Continental breakfast (hard boiled eggs, coffee, juice, toast, bagels, english muffins, butter and jam) was very fresh.  We had to park in public parking across the streedt as the hotel has limited space for parking but the staff went out every hour and fed the meters...so that was not a problem  As mentioned we weren't there for the beach and amenities but it  was pleasant to walt along the boardwalk (cement).  Hotel provides towels and stuff to take to the breach.  Cookies were good and available every afternoon.  We had no
Manager Response: Thank you for the review; I noted that you found the street side a little noisy.  It can be a bit like that on a 'big weekend' and Easter in Newport Beach is one of those.  When you come again, we have lovely rooms on the Bay side and we'd love to offer you one of those.  Again thank you for taking the time to write.

Summary: It's just like everyone mentions great, friendly staff who value their guests.  Beautiful, clean rooms that are a step from your cookie cutter hotels.  Cookies are great, the food delicious, walking distance to both beaches.  We were 100% satisfied and are planning on staying there during our next visit this summer.
Manager Response: Being a boutique hotel, we take great pride in our friendly, personal service and when you come back in the summer, my staff are sure to remember your name. Thank you for taking the time to write a review; our future guests are sure to appreciate your comments.

Summary Heading: Great location for going to beach
Summary: Stayed here twice but have  since found a home right next door to hotel. If you have been to Newport Beach you know parking is very difficult so staying at a hotel or home close to the beach is the only way to go. Hotel was clean, had a good breakfast, and was pretty quiet considering how much traffic is on Balboa Avenue. The peninsula is only two blocks wide where the hotel is. So one block to beach and one block to bay. WOW! They have boogie boards, beach chairs, towels, and some beach games to use for free. The best part is for breakfast and in the evening you can go up to a rooftop sitting area, has maybe five tables and chairs, and eat breakfast or have a glass of wine in the evening. You can see the ocean and the bay. Great for artists to draw. Only drawback is it is very
Manager Response: Glad you had two great stays with us!  Thank you for the review and compliments on all of the free amenities we offer. Yes, our location is wonderful; easy to see why you want to come back again and again to the Peninsula.

Summary: We had a wonderful time at the Bay Shores Penisula Hotel in December 2012 and we later even returned in the beginning of January after visiting Vegas. The reception is so friendly, the breakfast is good and you even get a fresh copy of the L.A. Times delivered to your doorstep every morning! There are freshly baked cookies in the lobby every afternoon and if it happens to rain you can grab a couple of movies from the lobby and cozy up in your room. The location is also fantastic, right by the beach and close to restaurants!  Anna and Risto, Finland
Manager Response: On aina hienoa saada vierailijoita ulkomailta - Toivon Las Vegas oli hyv√§ sinulle! Onnellinen olet nauttinut extrat kuten ev√§steet ja elokuvia. Toivon, ett√§ saamme j√§rjest√§√§ taas.

Summary: We were a mixed group, some attending a conference and some along for the ride.  The hotel staff were extremely helpful and welcoming.  The proximity to the beach and restaurants was welcome to avoid driving at the end of the day.  Returning to fresh baked cookies, free wifi, parking, and breakfast really topped off the deal.  The rooftop terrace is a lovely place to enjoy breakfast or just a moment of sun and quiet.  Definitely a place to remember when back in the area.
Manager Response: Tack f√∂r att du bor hos oss samtidigt som n√§rvarar vid konferensen. Jag √§r glad att vi kunde ut√∂ka v√•r g√§stfrihet till dig och ser fram emot ditt √•terv√§ndande bes√∂k en dag.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel six times over the past several years and just booked my next trip for next month. I cannot say enough about it. Very clean, wonderful staff and fresh baked cookies every afternoon. Directly across the street from the beach, great restaurants and the pier. You owe it to yourself to try it, you will not be disappointed.
Manager Response: I have stayed at this hotel six times over the past several years and just booked my next trip for next month. I cannot say enough about it. Very clean, wonderful staff and fresh baked cookies every afternoon. Directly across the street from the beach, great restaurants and the pier. You owe it to yourself to try it, you will not be disappointed  We LOVE our repeat guests!  Thank you so much for your loyalty; I am so glad that we continue providing you with such a pleasurable experience that you keep coming back.

Summary Heading: Great location and a clean comfortable room
Summary: We really enjoyed our time at this hotel.  It is in a beautiful location, right across from the beach (although no views except from the rooftop terrace.)  We stayed in Suite 100, which was nice and spacious, with a king, queen, and and queen sofabed, and the best part, 1-1/2 bathrooms.  Nice 50" TV (or thereabout!) and the DVD library adds a nice touch.  Continental breakfast is plentiful, and the afternoon cookies are a nice touch.  We were given plenty of bath towels (8 sets!) so we were never short, and the small fridge is great, along with the coffeemaker and microwave.  It is not 5-star accommodations, so set your expectations appropriately-- it is a cozy, extremely clean and super-conveniently located hotel, within walking distance from the beach and many restaurants, and
Manager Response: So pleased that you enjoyed my hotel and that you found the property to be clean, cozy and conveniently located. Yes, the suites do offer more space so I'm glad you mentioned that so other guests can enjoy those additional amenities.

Summary: I cannot say enough about this wonderful little gem of a hotel. Clean is not enough to describe the room we stayed in. The room we had was in the corner with a ocean view. I was a little worried about the noise, but do not worry, the windows are double paned. The staff greeted us by name, took us on a tour of the place, and left a nice note on the bed. Woke up and opened the door to a LA Times, with a note about the hotels many services. The room is perfect, I could not find anything to complain about except for the fact we had to leave. Book this place, there is nothing better, never will be.
Manager Response: Already planning your next trip?..Hurry back, your room and the cookies are waiting!  Thank you for your review, so glad you had a great time.

Summary Heading: We are already planning a return visit!
Summary: We had such a great experience at this hotel that we were planning our next trip while we were still there. Everyone was so friendly. We were on the 3rd floor in a corner room (#304) and had a great view of the ocean and bay. The afternoon cookies really hit the spot after riding our bikes on the boardwalk. We also enjoyed the roof deck in the evening with a glass of wine. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
Manager Response: Sounds like you had a wonderful time - wish I could have had that glass of wine on the roof top with you, it's one of my favorite parts of the hotel!  Thank you so much for staying with us and taking the time to write the review.  Looking forward to hosting you again and welcoming your friends and your family.

Summary: Warren greeted us with a big smile and friend "Hello".  We felt ourselves unwind right then, after the long drive to the coast.  He gave us a tour and we loved it all.  The location is a few minutes from the beach, fewer minutes to the harbor, a short walk to good (and great) restaurants, shopping, and the pier.  We never drove our car the entire four days.  Just walked everywhere.  The room was decorated in a sunny beach style, which was great.  The bed was comfortable.  Everything was clean and neat.  The pillows were a bit odd.  Small, square pillows which I found difficult to sleep with.  Will just bring my pillow from home next time.  But that is a small issue compared with all of the nice amenities this lovely hotel offers.  Breakfast with a good variety of foods, and a
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review. When you come again, just ask at the front desk and we'll see if we can set you up with a more comfortable pillow.  Glad you enjoyed the movies and the cookies - always looking to expand the collection so if you have any recommendations on titles just let us know!

Summary: Great hotel! The rooms were clean and nice, great and friendly service, nice terrace where you can have breakfast and enjoy the evening. They also have complimentary beach equipment. Great location, not far from a nice beach. Delicious complimentary cranberry cookies. Awesome.
Manager Response: Great hotel! The rooms were clean and nice, great and friendly service, nice terrace where you can have breakfast and enjoy the evening. They also have complimentary beach equipment. Great location, not far from a nice beach. Delicious complimentary cranberry cookies. Awesome.   Thank you for your visit and I'm glad you got to enjoy so many of our amenities. All the years I have owned the property, I have never got tired of the view from the terrace; I'm so pleased you got to enjoy it too.

Summary: So pleasantly surprised! Super clean, super friendly! Great breakfast! Loved the decor, so perfect for a beach-town.  It reminded me of your favourite auntie's house, so welcoming and wonderful.  Best feature though is its proximity to the beach! Literally across the street.  Stay here, you won't regret it!!   The only 'heads up' I would provide is that the parking lot is small and so is the breakfast room so in busy/peak times that could prove challenging. There's overflow parking which they offer so that should ease that trouble!  Just try to eat early or later to beat the rush!
Manager Response: Glad we made you feel at home.  Thanks for mentioning the parking; just like to add that if the hotel lot is full, we will feed the meter on the street for you!  Thank you for taking the time to write your review; see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Another great trip and stay here
Summary: Back again with some additional family members.  Great as usual and excellent weather for mid February.  All staff friendy as usual and a big thanks to Lisa and Ralph who assited us with a couple of problems we had.  They asked and listened to our concerns and addressed them more than satifactorily, A+. Family members had not been here before and yes they too would come back, as will we.
Manager Response: I cannot tell you how wonderful it is to have the privilege of hosting you and your family again! Glad we could sort out any problems you had - see you (and all your extended family!) again very soon.

Summary: This hotel represents all the reasons I like to use Trip Advisor.  It is a small hotel that represents good value and fantastic service.  We had planned to stay there for two days at the beginning of our holiday while we searched for a more upscale hotel.  Instead we ended up staying at the Bay Shores for six wonderful days.  The location is close to the pier and restaurants (Momma D's is excellent).  Loved the warm cookies that are served every day in the hotel at 3:00.  Very friendly and helpful staff. Really easy access to the Pacific Coast highway and the 55 freeway.
Manager Response: I'm so glad that you found my hotel to provide "good value and fantastic service." It will give me great pleasure to share your comments with my staff.  Thank you for letting other travelers know about your experience and I look forward to your return.

Summary: This is a great place!  The rooms were beautiful and very clean.  The beach is so close and the service was spectacular!  Bridget was very sweet and helpful with local recommendations.  The hospitality and overall feeling of warmth from everyone there was great.  The rooftop deck was a great perk with beautiful views.  I will absolutely stay there again if I have the fortune of being in the area.
Manager Response: We hope you do have the good fortune to return to the area and that we'll have the equally good fortune to again have you as our guest!

Summary: We stayed here last year after running in our first ever Half marathon.....the Surf City marathon.... and enjoyed it so much we returned again this year.  My husband and our friend took on the challenge of the full marathon while the ladies tackled the half again.  We can not say enough about the great staff, Warren, Ed and Bridgette were always willing to help us with anything we requested....wine glasses, hair dryers, directions or suggestions on places to see and eat.  The mornng breakfasts were great and the evening cookies delicious.  We upgraded to a king bed this year and it was very comfortable.  The location of this hotel makes it a great choice as you can walk to the beach, resturants and pubs.  We also enjoyed the feeling that we had the use of the full hotel and we
Manager Response: Glad we could help you 'carb up' for the big day; we'll be having those magic cookies waiting for you next year when you attempt the trifector!

Summary: We were in the area for business and decided to stay near the beach.  We are so happy we did!  This is definitely a place we will come back to and look forward to it!  Class, charm and character sum it up.
Manager Response: We're always glad to welcome our business travelers. Looking forward to making your return trip just as pleasant.  Good luck out there on the road!

Summary: We found Bay Shores on line, (while travelling Route 66) read the reviews and decided it was the place for us and wow what a place.  Looks small from outside but inside is great. The rooms where spotless, the beach is not even 2 minutes walk and the staff fantastic.  I had the misfortune of spraining my ankle the 2nd night in and the staff could not have been more helpful. They even offered to put me on the luggage trolley to get me back to my room. (haha) The homemade cookies were a fantastic treat for my partner also.  Couldn't think of a better place to stay, and this will be where we stay when we get back to the USA.  Thanks very much to you all.
Manager Response: So sorry to hear of your injury but glad that my staff were able to help out.  Thank you for the review and hope you'll get back to our part of the world soon - 'Advance Australia'!

Summary Heading: Lovely, friendly place to stay in Newport
Summary: We stayed here for 1 night during our trip up PCH last September. I read the reviews on TripAdvisor and wasn't disappointed! The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside it is clean, spacious and the hotel staff are so friendly and welcoming. There were delicious (still warm!) homemade cookies in the lobby which really hit the spot on our arrival from the San Diego area and they had a good DVD library - we did end up checking out a DVD to watch that evening which was very enjoyable. Our room was lovely, 'New England' type decor, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom warm and clean. They even left a nice personalised card on the bed, welcoming us - nice touch! Breakfast was great - there was a selection of foods to choose from: cereals, bagels, fruits,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind and comprehensive comments. I am so glad that you enjoyed our facilities and that everything added up to a pleasurable stay in Newport Beach.  Come back soon, we'll have warm cookies waiting especially for you!

Summary: Other than all the typical comments on location, value, good breakfast etc, the thing that comes to mind about this hotel is the outstanding friendliness. From the moment we checked in, we felt welcome. There was even a handwritten card in our room welcoming us. We had the privelage of having Warren checking us in, but they were all very nice. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Along with outstanding value, providing friendly atmosphere is our top priority.  I will pass on to my staff, but particularly Warren, how welcomed you feel. Thank you for your review; we all look forward to warmly greeting you again on your return.

Summary: We'd never visited Newport Beach before this trip, and chose the Bay Shores Peninsula based on its previous TA reviews. We can only echo the vast majority by saying our stay was very good.  As it turned out, we didn't spend a whole lot of time in Newport Beach during our stay. Rather, we explored various neighboring spots, as well as took a day trip to Los Angeles. But the time we spent here was very comfortable. All of our interactions with the front desk staff were great. (And, yes, they did feed the meter for us the one time we weren't able to get a parking space in the hotel lot.) The breakfast was just fine, with plenty of options. And the DVD library was a very nice touch.  If our travels ever bring us back to Newport Beach, it's hard to imagine we'd stay anywhere but this
Manager Response: Glad we could act as base camp for your stay and that you had some great day trips. Hope you do get back here one day; we'd love to share more of Newport Beach with you.  .

Summary Heading: Wish we would have stayed longer
Summary: This hotell is more like a motell in standard as you enter your room from a balcony running all along the back - which I find kind of charming and old Californian. However it IS a hotell with an excellent reception service offering you to lend a large range of DVD-films, magazines beach towles, beach toys, beach chairs and even boogie boards. We stayed in the rooms 221 and 223 on the second floor and could just see the Pacific Newport Peninsula beach through the houses on the other side of West Balboa Boulevard. Although we could hear the traffic at points it was not disturbing during our stay (in early January). The distance to the really beautiful beach is a 1-2 minute walk, and another 5 to reach the closest pier where a range of shops, coffe places, Ice cream parlors and
Manager Response: Tack f√∂r komplimangen. Vi hoppas att du kommer tillbaka och stannar med oss nydana f√∂retaget!

Summary Heading: Great location, wonderful free breakfast and fresh cookies
Summary: This hotel puts service first. It isn't the fanciest hotel but the kids took advantage of all the free services (DVDs, Beach toys, Breakfast and Fresh cookies).  Located walking distance to the beach, wharf and many restaurants.
Manager Response: We love kids here at Bay Shores and if yours have any suggestions for additions to our movie collection, we'll have them waiting for them on their return!

Summary: Let me join the chorus of reviewers who LOVE this small hotel. Great location, GREAT staff members who truly believe in customer service. Ralph and Bridget were both so helpful and friendly. Only a block from the ocean and walking distance to the pier, shops and restaurants. The rooms were lovely and the turn down service was a nice touch as were the evening cookies and the comnplimentary morning breakfast. I will definitely be back. Well done!
Manager Response: Having logged thousands of miles as a business traveler myself, I am always glad when I hear that someones time on the road has been made just that bit more comfortable.  Thanks for the review and have a happy holiday...at home!

Summary Heading: Awesome quaint hotel in Newport Beach
Summary: I relied on tripadvisor to find a good hotel close to Irvine where I had a medical procedure scheduled. The Bay Shores Peninsula was rated #1 and close enough for me. My husband and I felt welcomed from the time we walked in the door! Warren greeted us with fresh baked cookies and several good recommendations for dinner within walking distance. The room is small but very comfortable bed. The DVD was important as I needed to continue an exercise program I was using. They also have a ton of movies to choose from if you want. Breakfast was ample with fresh coffee, juice, milk croissants, cereal , hard boiled eggs, bagels, and a sausage egg sandwich. Highly recommend without reservation!
Manager Response: So glad that we could play a small part in your recovery.  Thank you for your compliments and for choosing us for your stay.

Summary: Very friendly staff and little extras made this the perfect place for us for a couple of days. A block away from the beach and close to shops and restaurants we did not need a car to enjoy our time here. From the free beach equipment and movies to the excellent afternoon cookies there were many little touches that make this hotel extra special. We spent a lot of our time in the hotel as one of us was not feeling well so also appreciated the roof top patio where we could eat our food and enjoy the view. The room itself was very clean and tidy  with a table and chairs on the walkway outside which we also enjoyed. The physical arrangement is more like a motel than a hotel but this seems to make it even nicer with the openness and courtyard below. We wished we could have stayed
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write the review and for mentioning the amenities you particularly enjoyed.  Just steps from the beaches and the shops, our location does make for a great  'car-free' vacation; so glad that you had a great stay!

Summary: We spent 2 nights at the Bay Shores Peninsula, though wish we were there for longer!  We were greeted very warmly by Warren and it was lovely to go to our room and find a welcome note, a fruit basket, chocolates on the pillows, good quality toiletries and other little extras which made us feel very welcome and pleased that we had not chosen a chain hotel.  It was lovely sitting up on the balcony enjoying the views while having the complimentary breakfast - a nice relaxed start to the day.  We borrowed boogie boards and dvds which was great for the kids.  We are a family of 5 and our room was nice and spacious, clean and comfortable.  Loved that wi-fi was included along with parking.  It was a real treat to come back in the afternoons and enjoy freshly made cookies! We would
Manager Response: We're so pleased that you enjoyed all the extras.  Nothing gives us greater pleasure than knowing you enjoyed our service and that you hope to stay again. Thank you for all the compliments which I will certainly share with my staff.

Summary: I found all staff lovely, warm and very helpful. A home away from home and I'm from Australia. Top quality toiletries and linens. Beds were comfortable and rooms quaint nautical and cosy. I highly recommend it for short or long stay. Rosemary, Melbourne Australia.
Manager Response: We're so glad that we were able to be your host while you were so far from home. We look forward to you coming back to these parts and providing you with the same great experience.  Travel safely!

Summary: We would never have found this gem without TripAdvisor reviews and we see now why people rave about the Bay Shores. We stayed 2 nights with our two teenagers in their suite (unit 100). We had a large living area with full dining table for 6, a queen bed, two sofas and a half bath. In addition was a separate bedroom with a king bed, and a large full bath with double sinks. Very comfortable beds and great shower. Our room was spotless and when we arrived a card was on the bed welcoming us. The staff are just as wonderful as everyone says and go out of their way to make you feel at home. The location of this hotel is wonderful with a quick stroll to the bay, the beach and Newport Pier. Lots of restaurants near by, bike rental and easy 10 min drive to Newports Fashion Island for
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your review; I am very pleased that your whole family enjoyed the stay and that your room was to your liking.  I'll be sharing your compliments with my staff who I know will also be happy to know that your stay was a success.

Summary Heading: Have been back (twice).  Just as good every time!
Summary: First visted May 2011 and have been back twice since then, Fall 2011 and Spring 2012.  Spring time brought other family members (mid 20's) and they loved the place too.  Hotel and staff GREAT as always and we'll be back again.
Manager Response: Nothing gives me greater pleasure than having return guests! So glad that you chose to come and stay with us again; we certainly look forward to seeing you when you come back to Newport Beach.

Summary: It's a perfectly nice, clean place to stay with nice staff, free parking, free wifi and a great breakfast. Our only complaints are (at least in our standard queen room) they had a funky shower head that wasn't very pleasant and the large windows faced the sun (in room 207) and didn't have black out curtains that you could close. So in the morning you better have an eye mask or the sun will shine thru the thin curtains and wake you up.
Manager Response: We're so sorry that you couldn't locate the blackout curtains; they are hung very close to the regular curtains and sometimes it can appear that there is only one set there. We've taken a look at that shower head for you too and made sure that it is acceptable for the next guest.  Thank you for taking the time to write your review.

Summary: I love this little hotel! Exceptionally clean, well appointed rooms and public spaces.  The staff is EXCELLENT!  Bridget is just about the nicest person I met while in California for a week on business, she is a gem!  The hotel is close to the beach, but watch the sunset from the 4th floor sun deck, very relaxing!  The fresh hot cookies at 3 pm are only rivaled by the abundant breakfast served in a quaint nook each morning.  Definitely will return!
Manager Response: So glad that you'll be returning one day; nothing gives us greater pleasure than to welcome back friends! Thank you for complimenting my staff; I am very proud of all of them and I am glad that they made your stay enjoyable.

Summary: We stayed here at the beginning and end of a business trip to Annaheim. What a treat! The staff is so incredibly helpful and nice. Yes, the rooms, bathrooms, breakfast room are small- it's a cute little vintage hotel and you're a block from the beach and the harbor! The rooms have just the right amount of "kitsch."  It's nice to have breakfast right there, and there's coffee and cookies all day. They have their own parking lot, which was great, and a washer and dryer if you go for a stroll on the beach and get accidentally soaked by a rogue wave (like I did.) There are restaurants within walking distance, but we weren't terribly impressed with the ones we chose. Sol Grill was quaint and the piano player was a nice touch, but the food was not wonderful. We enjoyed the Rock and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review - yes, that's who we are small, friendly and with a vintage vibe! I'm sorry some of the nearby restaurants weren't quite up to scratch; when you come back, stop by the Front Desk and let us find you something you'll enjoy as much as your recent stay with us.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a friend's wedding and it was a wonderful stay! Rooms were well kept, well stocked, the continental breakfast was plentiful, there was free wifi, and the staff was very friendly.  Sure, the breakfast nook could be bigger, sure the parking lot is small, and sure its not right on the beach. But they do really well making something wonderful out of what they have. At least they WILL pay the city meter for you! Other hotels leave you on your own in similar situations. They also have beach towels, chairs, and toys for free to borrow.   The card in our room welcoming us when we arrived, and the card they mailed thanking us for our stay after we got home were extra nice touches! No one does that kind of thing anymore it seems. We would definitely stay
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write; I am so glad that you enjoyed the personal touches.  We want every one of our guests to feel welcomed on their arrival and thanked for choosing us when they get home. Hope you do come back to Newport Beach some day; it will be our pleasure to serve you again.

Summary Heading: Thank you, TripAdvisor, for this one
Summary: Looking for a Newport-Irvine area alternative to the Hyatt (where you have to walk a mile with your luggage) and the Orange Cty. Airport hotels which have no "personality," I started hunting around on TripAdvisor, discovered this little place, and thought I'd give it a try.  What a pleasant surprise!  It's located on Balboa, just a block from the beach one direction and a block from the boats the other direction.  A good number of restaurant choices are just a couple of blocks away, as is the pier and a couple of bars and beach shops, etc.  The folks who work here are very friendly and clearly proud of the place.  They also offer a continental breakfast in the morning.  And, if you've go the time, there's a DVD player in every room and a selection of ~400 DVD movies to choose
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write; as someone who travels for business too, I appreciate how WiFi and DVD's can make all the difference when you're on the road. We'll be taking a look at the signal strength and seeing if we might not be able to boost it in that part of the hotel. Again, thank you for your comments and suggestions; catch you when you return.

Summary Heading: Seriously the only place to stay in Newport!
Summary: We spent a couple of days here. The rooms are incredibly clean, they are super friendly and helpful, and allow you to rent all of the beach gear you need. You can even rent DVDs from them. Parking anywhere in Newport is always tough, but they have their own parking lot! Perfect place to stay.
Manager Response: We're so pleased you enjoyed the complimentary beach equipment and free movies while you were staying with us. If you have any recommendations for other titles we might acquire for our guests pleasure, just let us know!

Summary: My wife flew to California for 10 days for a wedding, traveling from San Diego L.A.  We  stayed at Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel for two nights while traveling up the coast.  This is an outstanding hotel with a B&B vibe.  What stood out to us the most was the attention to detail and amenities, making our stay a pleasure and unbelievable value.  Amenities such as coffee all day, breakfast, cookies, DVD library, roof top deck with tables/chairs, and free beach gear were awesome.  Who flies with beach gear, like towels, chairs, and umbrellas?  When stopping in for two nights on our trip, borrowing their equipment (free) to head to the beach was so convenient.  Also, their front desk staff had great recommendations for local restaurants, bike rentals, and attractions.    One quick
Manager Response: It's our pleasure to anticipate your needs and to provide those "unexpected surprises" that make your stay just a little bit better; just a little bit more relaxing. Thank you for staying with us, for taking the time to write the review for recommending us to others.

Summary: Not much more to say that hasn‚Äôt been said already. We‚Äôve stayed at the BSP quite a few times over the years and it‚Äôs always the same, how do they do that? On the face of it this hotel shouldn‚Äôt be so good. It‚Äôs on the main road, it‚Äôs small and kind of old fashioned, yet somehow it works and everyone loves it. I‚Äôm struggling to think of any negatives but if there are any it‚Äôs the traffic noise which you get if you have a sea-view/corner room and I couldn‚Äôt find BBC America on the TV so I missed the last Doctor Who, sad I know, but I‚Äôve seen it now. Literally just received a postcard (yes, a real old fashioned postcard) from the hotel, thanking me for my stay, nice touch.
Manager Response: We're sorry you couldn't find BBC America!  Next time you stay with us, just give a quick call to the Front Desk and we'll let you know which channel it's showing on. Thank you for the lovely comments and we look forward to you joining us again.

Summary Heading: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Newport Beach!
Summary: We stayed here for our anniversary and loved this hotel.  We wouldn't stay anywhere else and we will always come back to Bay Shores when we return to Newport Beach.  Highly recommend this hotel.  The location is perfect and the service and amenities are incredible.  Lisa and Warren were the nicest people ever.  We loved all the little touches like the fresh baked cookies, the free beach equipment, free parking and the free bottled water they leave in your mini fridge in your room every day.  The rooms are super clean and decorated so nice.  We ate our included breakfast every morning outside on our rocking chairs.  It was very hard to leave and we wished we could have stayed longer.  We will be back one day for sure!
Manager Response: I cannot tell you how proud we all feel to receive your review!  Every day we aspire to provide our guests with the best vacation experience possible in Newport Beach and from your remarks, I think we acheived just that. We very much look forward to your return; thank you for taking the time to write.

Summary Heading: The perfect place to stay while in Newport Beach.
Summary: We stayed at Bayshore for three nights while visiting Newport and we both loved everything about it. I requested a 3rd story room away from the street and it was perfect (heard no street noise at all). Breakfasts are great with many things to choose from. Location is amazing - quick 3 minute walk to the ocean and many restaurants. there are so many extras that are no additional charge -parking, beach umbrellas, beach chairs, boogie boards, beach towels, cookies! :) This hotel/b and b completely understands customer service and made our stay perfect.
Manager Response: So glad that you both enjoyed all of the 'extras' but of all of the things we wish to provide for our guests, great customer service is our priority. I am so pleased that you found the service worthy of note and that your stay was 'perfect'!

Summary: We booked this hotel for one night and were so impressed we extended our stay for another night.  From the friendly and exceptionally accommodating staff to the outstanding amenities, every moment of our stay was perfect. There are freshly baked cookies in the afternoon, a breakfast that was way more than a normal continental breakfast, boogie boards, beach chairs, umbrellas and towels, all complimentary for guests.  The rooms are decorated with a nautical theme, clean and each with a special personal touch thrown in; ours had a nice note welcoming us and a fresh flower in a vase in the bathroom area.  We would highly recommend this to anyone wishing to have a unique boutique hotel experience with a beautiful beach a short block away.
Manager Response: So glad you extended your stay with us; nothing gives us greater pleasure than being able to provide additional hospitality.

Summary: This is a small, charming hotel within walking distance of the beach, Newport pier, and a lot of good seafood restaurants.  They provide beach chairs, towels, umbrellas for their guests and offer an extended continental breakfast.  It is located on Balboa Blvd, so the traffic noise is a distraction until midnight or so.  We will definitely go back.  Kudos to the great staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and the great comments. In summer, the traffic is a bit heavier on the Boulevard than at the rest of the year but your tip about asking for a room in the annex is a great one.

Summary: I travel a lot for business as well as pleasure and the Bay Shores exceeded all previous experiences. Parking is a premium here and yet if their lot is full, they make every attempt to find a spot for you. The breakfast is good and the other amenities are great. The hotel looks old but don't let that fool you. Inside has been totally refurbished and the rooms are nice. Thumbs up in my book!
Manager Response: Thank you for the 'thumbs up'! As a business traveler we very much appreciate you choosing Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel.

Summary Heading: great location, great hotel, great staff
Summary: The location was great. The water in the fridge daily was appreciated, the fresh baked cookies a nice touch, the hotel staff helpful, and the fresh flower in the bathroom sweet. The rooms were kept very clean, the bed was comfortable and the breakfast a bit more than continental. This is not the cheapest place as it was $200.00 a night but if we did not want to we did not have to drive, there was so much to do within walking distance, the breakfast was filling and adequate, we did not have to pay for parking. The hotel supplied boogie boards and nice towels and chairs( this would be the only small thing that could be updated , but at least they let the guests use them for free), so the price may seem a little steep but you save on so many other things and the staff is so wiling
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let me know how you found my hotel.  With regard to the free beach equipment, with the end of the summer, we'll be taking a look and checking if replacements need to be made.  Looking forward to your return!

Summary: Let me start by saying that I prefer to stay at Fairmont's and Four Seasons.  However, that being said, if you want to stay at a property in walking distance to the water this tiny little hotel is lovely.  The outward appearance is a little dated, but the interior is clean and thoughtfully decorated.  The front desk staff is welcoming and professional.  Complimentary breakfast is nice, coffee available all day, fresh baked cookies in the afternoon.  Walking distance to restaurants and beach.  The rooms facing the main street get a bit of street noise.
Manager Response: Thank you for commenting on the interior decorations; based on our customer feedback we wanted them to be as welcoming and comfortable as possible. I am glad that, along with our customer service, they were to your liking.

Summary: We stayed at the Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor.  It was just an OK experience.  For $170/night, we were expecting more.  The rooms were outdated and we had problems with our TV.  The customer service was great, but we will probably pick another hotel based on the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review - despite not meeting your expectations on price, I am very glad you found that our customer service was great.

Summary: We will return! Location is ideal.  The room was immaculate and inviting.  The shower water pressure was excellent, and the bed was comfortable. The staff made us feel welcome and at home. Access to the beach was so close, and what an amazing beach! We brought dinner in and dined on the rooftop terrace. The views are wonderful. We took our breakfast up there as well.   The only thing missing was more time.
Manager Response: If I could give you "more time" I certainly would!  Nothing gives us more pleasure than having guests for an extended stay.  Looking forward to your return!

Summary: The staff at Bay Shores is friendly, helpful, and always smiling.  The self-serve breakfast is extensive, the rooms are clean and spacious, and the fresh-baked cookies (in the lobby) are wonderful.  Also, I had to check out a day early (decided to explore other parts of California), yet the desk clerk did not charge me for the last night, and was very gracious about it, too.  One very minor complaint: my room was on the front of the building, with an ocean view, which was of course terrific, but the neon hotel sign and street lights were extremely glaring ta night, and unfortunately, the room had no heavy curtains to draw across to shut out the fierce glow, leaving the room lit up all night long.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment about the neon sign - I have made a note of that and will see what can be done to address the issue. Glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: We have been coming here for the past ten years if not more! We always feel like we are home! We grew up in the area but have lived in the Bay Area for the last 25 years. The rooms are immaculate. There is fresh fruit in your room and a welcome note on your bed. Fresh baked chocolate chip cookies are available every afternoon. Everything you need for the beach (towels, chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards) are free. The staff has ALWAYS been super friendly! Any time of the year, this is our #1 "go-to" spot!
Manager Response: As a long-term guest, we so appreciate your business and for taking the time to share with others what you've enjoyed for a decade!  Looking forward to always being your " #1 go-to spot!"

Summary Heading: Luxurious beach inn with a homey vibe
Summary: I was a little nervous about booking this hotel, despite all of the rave reviews.  When I saw the pictures of the surfers on the wall I thought that it might be kitchy or some divey beach hut.  Boy, was I wrong!  From the second you walk in the door, the staff treats you like an old friend.  We always felt welcome and at home when we walked through the door.  The staff is friendly and willing to answer any questions and offer you suggestions about the area. There's free parking on the premises and if you can't get a spot, park across the street in a public lot and they feed the meters for you!  They constantly have fresh baked cookies at the front, a pretty extensive collection of DVDs that you can borrow 2 at a time, provide you with bottled water and fruit in your room at no
Manager Response: Thank you for your review; we're glad you felt right at home because that is our intention! Looking forward to you coming back soon.

Summary: We have stayed several times at this Hotel, and I must say I have never met or come across a more attentive staff. They are at your becken call to make sure your stay is flawless and hassel free. The rooms are extremely well kept with large flat screen tv's, dvd players etc. Walking distance to the beach (few hundred ft.)and so on, you cannot go wrong staying at The Bay Shores penninsula Hotel, but I must say again, it is the staff and General Manager Ralph that really make your stay worth while and unforgettable. I have traveled extensively for business and stayed at some of the nicest Hotels in the country, but my stays were always hindered by the lack of and quality of service, this WILL NOT happen at the Bay Shores Hotel, try it you'll like and will want to return time after
Manager Response: It is so important to us that our service meets your needs and matches your expectations.  Thank you for being so complimentary about my staff; we shared your post at our weekly meeting!

Summary: I cannot wait to go back to this cute little hotel. I loved that you could go up on the roof and have almost a 360 degree view of water or watch the sun set. Everything was clean and the staff was very friendly. I will definitely return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! So glad you had a lovely time; I look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary: We are staying here for a 3 day get-away.  The hotel is located on the Balboa Peninsula.  This is not your large, cookie cutter, impersonal resort.  Literally steps from the bay on one side and steps from the ocean on the other side.  There are lots of restaurants, at all price levels, within easy walking distance.  Parking was free, which for this area is a huge benefit.  If there is not enough parking on the property, staff will feed the meters free of charge at the city lot across the street.  Breakfast is a very nice large continental breakfast and included in the price.  Many items to choose from.   The rooms are very clean and include a small fridge with cold water.  Fresh fruit.  Very good bath products.  It's a modest facility at first glance, But just done so well.
Manager Response: So glad you are enjoying your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments; we very much appreciate your taking the time to write the review

Summary: Frankly, we were shocked at the prices of accommodations in Sunset Beach.   Of course we wanted to be on the beach or as close to it as we could find.  We looked and looked but simply felt that $400+ a night was too much.  Then we stumbled into Bay Shares Peninsula Hotel.  It would have been nice to be right on the beach but, hey, we can walk across the street if it saves us a couple hundred $$!  But it wasn't just about the location.  Bay Shores offered warm and helpful personnel, charm, fabulous fresh-from-the-oven lemon or chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon, a huge shower, open deck on the top level, a complete breakfast, free wi-fi, free equipment rentals (beach chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards, towels and ?), a very comfortable bed, in room bottled water, nice
Manager Response: I am very glad you enjoyed my hotel and that the next time you are in SoCal you'll be staying with us.  The cookies will be waiting!

Summary: What a great little place this is! We stayed for 3 nights in July and this was my favourite hotel out of the 5 we stayed in on a tour of Las Vegas & California. It has a real home from home feel about it.  From the home baked cookies everyday to the DVD library and the lovely helpful staff. We got parked ok in the car park and had a lovely room (305). Staff were great in ensuring we were ok and recommended some lovely nearby restaurants (The Old Spahetti House and Il Forno were our favourites). The location was fantastic as was a very short walk to the beach and also near to Newport Pier. Balboa Pier is about a 30 minute walk away but you can do this alog the each front or even rent a bike to do this if you don't like walking! The free loan of beach towels and beach equipment is
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for mentioning the amenities you enjoyed; it really helps us strive to provide for your every comfort.

Summary: This hotel is great. The most impressing thing is the staff that are so friendly. Every night when we came back in we got warm chocolate chip cookies. They go out of their way to make your stay a great experience. The rooms are nice and clean. Its close to the beach and hotel provides body boards, towels, umbrellas etc. They also rent out free movies! I would highly recommend this place, we had such a great time.
Manager Response: I am very glad that you had an enjoyable stay and that you were able to take advantage of the movie collection - would love to have your recommendations on any new titles you think we should add.

Summary: This feels like a European Boutique hotel.  The staff could not be friendlier or more accommodating.  The rooms are small but clean and nice.  We had regular rooms as well as the family suite and they were perfect. LOVED having the beach toys and amenities.  Great breakfast, snacks and movies for use.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Very happy to hear you enjoyed the Family Suite. When my own family comes to stay, we enjoy it too!  Hope you come and visit again

Summary Heading: Their Website Address Says It All
Summary: We have stayed here several times and each time it feels more like home.  This hotel is the definition of upscale comfortable.  The rooms are tastefully appointed, the beds are just right, the showers have great water pressure, and the rooms are immaculate.  Probably the cleanest hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in.  I personally like that they deliver the LA Times to your door each morning.  There‚Äôs nothing like having a fresh croissant, coffee and the paper to start your day.    The hotel‚Äôs location can‚Äôt be beat - it‚Äôs just a block from the beach on the Balboa Peninsula and about 2/10th of a mile from the Newport Beach pier.  As one who is used to great beaches and beach towns in Massachusetts, I have to say that these beaches are special both for their expansiveness and because, when
Manager Response: Very pleased you had a great stay and thank you so much for the wonderful accolade.  We work very hard to be worthy of our website address; please return soon and check we are living up to our name!

Summary: My partner and I travelled from Glasgow and stayed at the hotel during the first two weeks in July. Having read the previous reviews on this site, I was prepared to be disappointed as I didn't think anywhere could live up to the great reviews I had read however, I have to say I would have to agree with all the great things that have been written about this place.The staff are so welcoming and helpful and the hotel itself is clean and very well equipped with everything you could need to make your stay hassle free, including the free use of beach equipment, towels etc. Our room was cleaned daily and towels changed every day and then the staff would come in at night to turn your bed down and ask if you needed any more towels! Fantastic service from everyone. Great choice of food
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a wonderful little place.  The staff are all very pleasant and helpful.  Rooms are very clean and comfortable.  Nice selection for continental breakfast and delicious cookies in the afternoon.  Location very easy to get to and only 1 block from the beach.  Easy walking distance to many restaurants, Balboa ferry, Balboa & NB piers. Stayed for 5 days to celebrate 60th birthday with my best friend and I can't wait until we visit again!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I spent a short getaway in Newport Beach and could not have been happier with this hotel.  It was super clean,  a half block from a gorgeous ocean beach and the hotel has umbrellas, sand chairs and even kids beach toys to take to the beach! Free Wi-fi and a terrific no hassle quiet breakfast made this place a hit with us.  We are East Coasters visiting LA family but every trip from now on,  will include a night or two at this great little hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed for two nights during our honeymoon trip across California.  The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, and very kindly offered us an upgrade on arrival given the occasion.  Rooms are large and very clean - the pictures do not do them justice as they are very well done out.  Beach is just across the road and it's very near the local restaurant/bar scene.  Breakfast and home baked cookies also excellent.  Thanks for a fantastic stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were guests at the Bay Shores for 2 nights, and were very happy with our stay.  The location can't be beat..only one short block to the ocean.  The staff, especially Ralph, is friendly, helpful and professional. It's nice to return from a day seeing the sights, and to be greeted by name! The buffet breakfast is a nice touch, as are the fresh cookies each afternoon.  Our room was comfortable and clean.  The bathroom was large and well stocked with amenities.  They offer a library of complimentary DVDs, newspapers, beach towel and chairs...it's like staying with friends!  We highly recommend Bay Shores!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Thank you to the staff at the Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel. They were helpful, and the hotel is tops! The hotel is conveniently located right across from the beach and the bay. It is a cozy hotel with all the amenities included, and our stay could not have been better. We will come back here for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I can only echo reviews of others who have made this the highest Tripadvisor-rated property in Newport Beach. Stayed there recently over Memorial Day weekend. Everything was good or better than I recall when I last stayed there 10 years ago. Rooms are well furnished, location is perfect for a beach weekend. Best to park the car & forget it as spaces are limited. (Staff will feed the meter if there isno hotel parking left). We walked all over Balboa Peninsula. There is an extensive DVD library for guests as well as complimentary breakfast which has a feel of eating in your own kitchen at home. Look forward to staying there again when visiting Newport.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The Most Amazing Hotel With A Wonderful Atmosphere
Summary: My family stayed at the Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel over Memorial Day Weekend, 2012. We rented 3 rooms and had 2 people in each room.   I cannot begin to tell you how quaint this hotel is. The atmosphere is uncomparable and its location to the beach is amazing. We live in Las Vegas and it was wonderful to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and enjoy some time here. The rooms were cozy andcomfortable. They were spotless and very tastefully decorated. Upon arrival there were fresh flowers in each room as well as a fruit basket and a card on the pillow welcoming the guests. Manager Response: none

When we first got there I remember the smell of fresh cookies (delicious) and how relaxing the lobby felt. The suite that we stayed in was so cozy everything in the room was perfect and the beds are so comfortable. It had a overall cozy beach feel we didn't want to leave. The balcony off the room was wonderful it has very comfortable rocking-chairs. In the morning that is were we would eat the continental breakfast, (which was good) have our coffee, and gaze at the ocean. I would deffiently stay there again, I feel in love with the hotel and already have planned to stay there next year. I have no

The amenities were all that and more, from the coffee and breakfast selections, fresh fruit, daily newspaper, wifi (although a tad bit weak on signal strength),a nd the friendliness of the staff!! Of and a great free movie selection if you are into that. Also, they have beach chairs, and boogie boards to use for the beach! We had a great time and will stay there again!! well done! Oh, one last thing, make sure you have a coffee on the roof patio! great view

Summary: Very clean and quaint room with great amenities. Far more than I expected! I've stayed in many hotels, and this one is definitely one of the best. Great breakfast, and fresh flowers in our room. Great staff, too! I would LOVE to stay here again!

Summary: My parents came to visit and stayed here...it was fantastic! The staff is extremely friendly, they clean the rooms to perfection everyday, and they have a nice continental breakfast each morning. My parents stayed in the room with a deck and a fireplace, which was wonderful. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. If you are looking for a classic beach hotel with great customer service, this is the place!

Summary: This is a great hotel! Concierge John gave us free admission tickets incl. complimentary drinks for a cool local bar. The room was well-sized and the decor was nice (loved the little surfers on the bathroom wallpaper). During the day you can go to the kitchen next to the reception and help yourself with coffee, tea and snacks. Freshly baked afternoon cookies are delicious! There is a lot of beach equipment as well as beach towels that you can borrow for free and the hotel is ideally placed to go jogging along the beach. We parked in the public parking across the street and the hotel paid for it. Good dining options in the area and convenience store 200 yd away.

Summary: Had a 2 night stay this past weekend in a standard room w/ queen bed. For the price, it was a nice place to stay, but the #1 ranking is definitely only based on it's quality-to-value ratio.  Some good impressions: - The location is perfect for a short getaway - giving short walking distance access to great beaches, boardwalk, pier, lots of restaurants, baloboa island etc. - The weather was lousy but only the last day we enjoyed the rooftop deck, great views - The staff was friendly, but not overly so  - The room was small but fastidiously clean - Even our room w/o a view had a pretty decent view - I got sucked in by the chocolate chip cookies!!  - The AM breakfast spread was suprisingly good - LA Times at your door every am - Nice amenities in each room including a fridge, dvd
Manager Response: Hi Chefesita,  Yikes, I am so sorry for mix up on the automated phone wake-up system!  I hate it when that happens.  The business guest in that room before you was there for a week and had the wake-up programed for the same early time every morning, and we failed to be sure it was cancelled.  On your next stay with us please accept a free room upgrade to hopefully somewhat alleviate this inconvenience.    ---Fred Pratt, Owner

Summary Heading: Great spot to be near the beach but centrally located in LA
Summary: Our long weekend was taking us to Burbank one day and Temecula the next.  This was a great spot to be able to get to both locations and still be near the beach so that we could take hour long strolls along the beach or the boardwalk before or after our daily trips.  Helpful staff.  Small but nice rooms.  Good variety for breakfast.  Dated but convenient collection of DVRs.    One note - if you face the street and open the window, it can be very noisy.  We tried shutting the window but there was no option to cool down the room so we were quite hot at night.
Manager Response: Hi Fritch,  Thank you for the nice review of my property!  I'm a bit concerned however about your comment on not being able to cool off the room.  We have relatively new individual air-conditioning units in each room, with "fan only" options for bringing in fresh air for folks who dislike a/c, was your unit not working or did the staff not explain that option to you?  With the windows shut and the fan running, most of the street noises will disappear.  Thanks again for staying with us and for the nice review, we hope to see you again sometime!     ---Fred Pratt, Owner

Summary Heading: Great for Fun, but good for Business Travel too
Summary: Doing business in Orange County offers a couple of possibilities:  stay at the chain hotels adjacent to the office(s); or stay at the beach. I like the laid-back style of Newport Beach.  Yes, it is a wealthy neighborhood, but there's a great surfing under-culture and everybody is of a certain age with sand in their hair and in their socks from having been on the beach in the last couple of hours (day or night...). The Bay Shores hotel is like that; it's an older hotel a block from the beach boardwalk, but the ocean feels very close by and the air is very fresh.  When showering, the smell of the water and the force of the shower-head made me feel like I was washing off after early morning surfing (which I wasn't).  Many of the 2nd and 3rd floor rooms are accessed by open air
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our favorite beach get away. Walking distance to numerous great restaurants. We even did a several block pub crawl. The pier is a couple blocks away. It is reasonably priced for what you get. Clean, great service, best continental breakfast ever. Antique style elevator is pretty cool too. We have stayed both in summer and winter. Love it. We will be back again. There is a roof deck with ocean and bay views.

Summary Heading: Homey, old style beach hotel with great service
Summary: A friend and I stayed in the suite at this hotel last month and it was a great value and location. The staff there is helpful and friendly, especially the woman who helped me with the reservation and assisted us while we were there for two nights. It felt safe and comfy and very clean and they serve a hearty breakfast every morning. You can eat it in their dining area, in your room or up on their deck overlooking the ocean...it's a lovely spot. The parking is okay if you can get into their lot or you may have to walk across the street although it's a quiet neighborhood so that's not really a problem. I felt security was good and the maintenance man was helpful in securing a gate for us. We liked this place a lot and would stay here again. It's literally one block from the beach

Newport is not crowded and a very easy drive from where I live in Las Vegas.  The second time I brought my daughter and Grandson and it was just as great.  It was Christmas time and we went to see the annual Boat Show!  Lots of decorated boats crusing the harbor (which you can see from the roof).   My Grandson acts like it is a home away from home!  And they have an excellent breakfast, afternoon cookies, free beach equipment and movies to borrow.  So glad I discovered this place! So now I'm here later with the dish on my stay.  After seeing that the Bay Shores Peninsula Hotel had an acceptable rating, I called to book a room for one reason and one reason only: it was across the street from the beach. Summary: I had a two day break from an intense business trip and this was the perfect place to spend it. The hotel is small enough to get personal attention. The decor is wonderfully suitable for a beach location. Little things make a stay there delightful - the roof deck where you can watch the sun set over the Pacific (if you sit at the high table), the availability of beach equipment at no charge, the free wireless and parking, the cookies in the afternoon and a surprisingly adequate breakfast considering there is nothing cooked (there are breakfast sandwiches you can warm up in the microwave). The bed was comfortable and the bathroom and room were spotless. I liked that the housekeeping staff left doors and windows open to let the sea breezes in (of course closing them afterwards).

The breakfast room was great, we could help ourselves to breakfast which was quite cute. Teak and coffee was also available all day, and the gorgeous homemade cookies provided at 3pm onwards with ice cold milk from the fridge was a great idea. The sundeck on  the top floor was fabulous, unfortunately the weather was not great for us. I was a bit disappointed with the greeting from the receptionistafter other reviews I had read, but generally this is nit picking. A gem of a hotel - but must keep up with the customer service standards I had read about.

Summary: We stayed at the Bay Shores Peninsula hotel for 2 nights in February when we were visiting our son who is a student at UC Irvine. We were able to walk along the beach to the place he is renting in Newport Beach. We would definately come back and stay again.  the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The hotel provides lots of ameneties including free breakfast, free parking and a huge collection of movies that you can borrow from the downstairs lobby.  The hotel is old but very well maintained which makes it quaint and cozy. The rooms are small but clean and well stocked  You can also hang out on the roof top deck where we watched the sunsets. There's a nice breakfast area with a fabulous array of breakfast foods to eat, coffee, juice, milk, variety of coffee.  The staff is amazing.  So friendly and helpful.

The continental breakfast room is stocked well & you have access to it all day, with microwave, fruit & coffee, even fresh baked cookies in the afternoon. It's located within close walking distance to more restaurants than you'd ever need. The beach is one block forward, the harbor is one block behind, & the "blocks" are really minimal. The staff can't help you enough, they are super!!! If they run out of parking spots, they will plug the meter for you in an adjacent lot. Can't think of anything that was a negative. Summary Heading: Great, Friendly Place to Stay Steps from the Beach
Summary: We've stayed here a few times.  Its our favorite place in Newport Beach.  The rooms are clean and large with spacious bathrooms.  The staff is always friendly and willing to help out with whatever you need.  Parking and Wi-Fi are both Free.  There's a better than average free breakfast which is best enjoyed on the rooftop terrace with a pristine view of the beach and ocean.  Free home baked cookies every afternoon.  Oh - and did I mention you literally walk across the street and are on one of the best beaches anywhere?  The hotel also provides beach towels, beach chairs, boogie boards, and other sand/beach toys free for your use.  We'd never stay anywhere else in Newport.

Summary: We have stayed here many times, usually during the holidays. Located between the beach and the bay, it is walking distance to beach, resturants, shops, etc. The rooms are smallish, but comfortable.  A very clean, friendly place to stay.

Before I left I reserved two more days for the coming summer. I would recommend this place to everyone.

The rooms are small but well designed and furnished, a good flat screen tv with DishNetwork. There is a free breakfast, though only three tables available and the hot items don't include vegetarian options, but there's a generous selection of cereals. The beach is half a block away and many area restaurants within easy walking distance. Our service varied, grumpy on checking in and getting better with each day. It gives you a thoroughly pleasant stay virtually on the beach.

The next morning, we had a great long run along the peninsula.  This really works well for us before continuing onto San Diego.  I hope I have the occasion to return.

My husband and I were in California visiting friends and family and we had a lot of them uses the public parking facilities across the street - the hotel staff offered to run across there and fill the meter with quarters for us if my family couldn't get to their car before the meter ran out! Summary Heading: Definitely deserves to be number ONE!

Breakfast is served daily and offers lots of choices, and fruit and cookies are always available.  The staff are extremely friendly and helpful.  The front desk people are as capable and helpful as the best concierges at fancy resorts.   The location is wonderful (there's a shuttle service the staff can help arrange that's $20/each way from LAX to the hotel).  I stayed there for business, and the hotel is so close to the beach that I was able to carve out a little beach time in my very hectic schedule.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel in a perfect location; we'll be back!

The hotel consists of a main building with queen or king beds and an "annex", which was an adjoining house that was converted into guest rooms.  The main building consists of 3 floors of rooms.  The 4th floor is a small sun deck with a spectacular view of both the Balboa Bay and the ocean.  There is a small but quaint break room with free coffee (of pretty good quality, actually) and snacks.  The annex is quieter, has larger rooms, and includes those rooms with 2 queen size beds. Summary Heading: Yes, Bay Shores Inn is Newports Best Kept Secret!
Summary: Just returned from a three night stay at the Bay Shores Inn in Newport Beach CA.  It is the best kept secret!  Front desk staff is the best helping us with all our questions.  Our room was over sized with chocolates on the pillows and a Thank-you note.  The room was very clean with a table and chairs for four where we ate breakfast and the room had a small sofa all the things you don't usually find.  No need to bring beach gear they have it all which is really nice.  Every afternoon they have homemade cookies in the lobby.  They have a nice sunroof and just check out the view!  We could walk to the beach and ride our bikes all over the place.  We will be back to the Bay Shores Inn.  Don't let the secret out!

Summary: During our vacation in the U.S. we stayed at the Bay Shores Inn for two nights in September 2005 and we really enjoyed our stay.  We made our reservation for 3 people through Best Western's web site and what we got was a suite with 2 large rooms (it did cost almost twice that of a normal room, though). Summary: How can you not love a place that is a block from the ocean, a half block from the bay, and that provides you with beach towels, chairs, & umbrella?  Not to mention home made chocolate chip cookies every day! (Get there fairly soon after 3:30, they go fast). The room was great - as clean as the other reviews mention and very reasonable.  We didn't have a car, but the bus was just a 2 block walk (we only took it to the Balboa Ferry).  Only a couple of blocks from Newport Pier and restaurants.  And, oh the ocean.... A truly wonderful place to stay,

Summary: This is an excellent little hotel, in the best location for Newport Beach. The rooms were bright and large enough, decked out in old seafaring antiques. The staff were really helpful too. As the beach is a mere 40 yards away the guy at the desk offered me his surfboard to use, which I did! I WILL go back and stay here, because it is a great base for visiting South LA. If your looking for a hotel in Newport Beach area STOP looking. You've just found it!

Summary Heading: Great inn, almost a bed and breakfast
Summary: This was a great little hotel.  When we checked-in around 4 p.m. they had fresh (and hot) chocolate chip cookies in the lobby.  The staff went out of their way to find things for us to do.  They even had free movies to watch in the rooms since every room has a VCR.  It was a great stay and you cant beat the location.

Summary: We loved this hotel!   Quait is a great way to describe this place.  Small, extremely clean, friendly personnel, and a great room.   The "Ocean View" room doesn't give much of a view, but the beach is 30 paces from the hotel.   It's in walking distance of several eateries and has beach goodies for your use.   I will definately be going back!

Summary Heading: Skip the so-called bay view rooms
Summary: This well located 3 story hotel was clean and right across the street from the beach and the boardwalk.The rooms had every amenity you would need except a refrigerator.Do yourself a money saving favor and skip the more expensive so-called "view" rooms - all you really see is the tops of sailboat masts viewed across the roofs of adjacent buildings.When I complained about this little deception, the desk clerk was unmoved.
